She buys passion fruits and oranges from Owino market and uses public transport to and from shopping.  Harriet goes shopping once a week.   She will use this loan to buy more bags of passion fruits, sugar and oranges.  Harriet has been in this business for eleven years.  Besides this soft drink business she also owns a video library and sells from her home.  She works seven days a week and her main challenge is that during rainy season she does not sell as much because the demand is low.

Harriet wants to make more profits from her business to be able to look after her family.  She joined MCDT because  they provide her with timely loans. She resides in and rents a two roomed house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.   Her monthly expenses include food, school fees and food .

loans.use: To buy bags of passion fruits, sugar and oranges

loans.name: 020806 - Hoang Dong - Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Lan L. T. is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Dong - Hoang Hoa.  Lan is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 20806 (20806 - hoang dong - hoang hoa).


Lan is married and has four grown-up children.  To making a living, Lan operates a family business raising cattle for sale.  Lan has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 400,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from these activities.


In 2006, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,749,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND which will be used to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her family business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. T. Ninh is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  C. T. Loan is a 55-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  N. T. Chuc is a 55-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  N. T. Ngoc is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lan L. T. (208026) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang dong - Hoang hoa.  Lan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 20806 (20806 - hoang dong - hoang hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Lan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lan kiếm được khoảng 400,000 VND.  Vào 2006, Lan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 30,749,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. T. Ninh (208046) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  C. T. Loan (208021) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  N. T. Chuc (208041) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  N. T. Ngoc (208022) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly D. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 52 years old and is married with seven school-aged children.

Shirly owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. She dreams of seeing all her children finish college and have bright futures.

Shirly joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Shirly is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase rice and corn seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase rice and corn seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Giang

texts.en: Giang N. T. is  52 years old. She has 2 children who attend high school and a Tourism and Commercial College. Before joining our credit program in 2006, she had a small grocery shop which made a very small profit. Since accessing her first loan from SEDA, she has run a butcher shop and has made enough income to pay for her family expenditure. She is a good client. Currently, she wants a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy more pigs as fresh products, to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more pigs as fresh products

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla Vanesa, hace mas de 12 años que tiene este negocio que es la venta de ropa nueva y usada, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, sus clientes llegan a buscarla a su vivienda en donde tiene una buena parte de mercadería, ella también sale a vender todos los días  temprano,  ella es muy humorista y reconocida por su gran carisma que ofrecer. Para Karla el tener un negocio le ha representado el fortalecimiento de su independencia para su hogar. Este crédito es para la compra de faldas, vestidos, trajes, camisetas, pantalones y shorts entre otras.
texts.en: Karla Vanesa, who has been in the business of selling new and used clothes for more than 12 years, has 2 young children. Her customers arrive to find her at her house where she has the majority of her merchandise. She also goes out to sell early every morning. She has a very good sense of humor and is known for her great charisma. For Karla, having a business has represented the strengthening of her independence for her home. This loan is to buy skirts, suits, shirts, pants and shorts, among other things.

loans.use: Capital for Work

loans.name: Arman

texts.en: Arman G. is married with one child. The family lives with Arman’s parents who are pensioners. Arman’s wife takes care of their child. Arman has been running a car seat and furniture upholstery renovation business since 1995. Currently he is using two old sewing machines at his rented small factory room. To revive the business Arman would like to replace the old sewing machines with new ones and get a large volume of good quality fabric. This will increase Arman’s profit by 25%.

loans.use: purchasing sewing machines and upholstery fabric

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 35 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 8 and 6.  She is a businesswoman who sells milk.  She has been able to learn about business management through Faulu Kenya.  This is why she has managed to run her business for three years.  She hopes to supply milk at wholesale in the future.  She has been guaranteed a loan of 20,000 KES by her group members in Faulu Kenya.  With the loan, she will open a milk bar.

loans.use: To open a milk bar

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO ”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eusebia ; ella tiene 40 años de edad ,viuda  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa , viajando cada fin de semana de Cusco a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado ,quedándose 2 a 3 dias  para luego retornar a Cusco al cuidado de sus hijos   . 

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio  ya que es el único sustento para su familia.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eusebia belongs to the “Puntualito” community bank which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name.

Eusebia is 40 years old.  She is a widow and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling clothes.  Every weekend she travels from Cusco to the city of Puerto Maldonado, staying there 2 or 3 days before returning to Cusco to look after her children.

She is requesting this loan to expand her business since it is the only means of support for her family.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To expand her business as it is the only means of support for her family

loans.name: Gogaya Women's Group, Mubende

texts.en: Florence N. is the leader of Gogaya group in Mubende. She is 36 years old and is married with 4 children, all of whom are in school. Florence has a bar business where she has been selling beers, sodas, wines and other drinks for over seven years. Before setting up the bar business, Florence was a civil servant and was just as hard working as she is today. She is requesting a loan to buy more beers and sodas for resale. Her dream for the future is to be able to construct a commercial building for the business and to provide and education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beers and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Duo Solidario Fuente De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
DUO   SOLIDARIO
FUENTE  DE AGUA VIVA 


Esta formado, de dos personas, Clara T., y Vilma Raquel P., ellas, están casadas, con dos  y tres hijos. 
Se dedican a la elaboración y venta de güipiles. Clara, borda los güipiles típicos de su pueblo, y los luego los vende en diferentes tiendas y mercados de su pueblo. Clara y dos señoras más le ayudan a bordar los adornos de los güipiles.
Clara solicita este préstamo de KIVA para invertir mas en confección de tejidos, ya que se acerca la fiesta de Navidad.    Y es cuando ella logra vender  más.
El sueño de clara es   remodelar su casa y mejora su vida, económicamente junto a su familia.
texts.en:
SOLIDARITY GROUP
FUENTE DE AGUA VIVA  (Fountain of Running Water)
This group has two members, Clara T. and Vilma Raquel P..  The women are both married and they have two and three children respectively.

These women make and sell 'güipiles' (traditional blouses).  Clara embroiders 'güipiles' which are traditional to her town and then sells them in different stores and markets in her town.  Vilma and two other ladies help her to embroider the decorative parts of the 'güipiles'.

Clara is requesting this Kiva loan to invest in making textiles since the Christmas period is approaching and she sells more of her products during this period.

Clara's dream is to remodel her home and improve her life financially, together with her family.

loans.use: To make textiles

loans.name: Edith Maribel

texts.es:
Edith, reside en El Triunfo, departamento de Usulután donde vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 18, 12 y 1 ½ años de edad, tiene 35 años y se dedica al comercio en una tienda donde ofrece productos de la canasta básica, este negocio lo administra desde hace 10 años, en el mercado municipal de El Triunfo,  de lunes a domingo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de arroz, azúcar, frijol, aceite, bebidas, este préstamo le ayudara a tener a disponibilidad de los clientes toda esta mercadería que es demandada a diario. 
El propósito de ella es seguir generando a su familia los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades del hogar, también quiere crecer ampliando su negocio.
texts.en: Edith lives in El Triunfo, in the department of Usulután, where she lives with her husband and three children ages 18, 12, and 11/2 years.  She is 35 years old and has a store that sells basic goods.  She has run this business for 10 years in El Triumfo's municipal market Mondays through Sundays.  She is taking out a loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, and drinks.  This loan will help her make all of this merchandise, that is needed each day, available to her customers.  She plans to continue generating the necesary income for her family to take care of the household bills and she also wants to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, and drinks.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banankabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce des tissus, des produits cosmétiques et des condiments.                                                                                   
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                                    
COUMBA K. s’approvisionne en produits cosmétiques à Bamako le plus souvent. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement à domicile et au marché de Fana, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes passagers.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group, all married, have an average age of 35 and 4 children. They all live in large traditional families in the city of Fana, the neighbourhood of Banankabougou, Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region in the republic of Mali). They met each other through kinship ties and do business in fabrics, cosmetic products and condiments.

The women of the Danaya group are requesting their first loan. 

Coumba Keita stocks up on cosmetic products in Bamako the most often. She makes her sales from home and at the Fana market for cash and on credit to a clientele composed of men and women who pass by. She foresees an average monthly profit of 15 000 CFA francs which will be used to pay back the loan, take care of health-related expenses, food, school fees, and the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, tiene 61 años, es casada, tiene seis hijos y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Ella después D. hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a su negocio, ella tiene un pequeño kiosko en el colegio “Arco Iris” D. la ciudad del Cusco. Ella venD. caramelos, galletas  y muchas cosas más a los alumnos del colegio en la hora D. recreo. Susana requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo dulces, galletas, tortas, postres, etc.

Susana pertenece al banco comunal “Renovación” D. la UMF Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal está conformado por personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Susana is 61 years old, married, has six children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. After doing the household tasks, she works at her business which is a small kiosk at the Arco Iris School in the city of Cusco. She sells candy, cookies, and many other things to the school students during recess. Susana needs the loan to purchase merchandise like sweets, cookies, cakes, desserts, etc.

Susana belongs to Asociación Araiwa’s Renovación Communal Bank in Cusco, Peru. The communal bank is comprised of enterprising and hardworking people who always look for opportunities to get their children ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Sman's Group

texts.en:
This group loan include of four members. They are located in Chanlak village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Sman C. was born in 1963, and she is a group leader. She has been selected as the group leader by the other group members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows vegetables. To support this farming, she needs funds. So, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing her vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Chhorn Chheng, is a fisherman who is able to earn a little income to support his family. He also helps in his wife's farming.

This couple has eight children: three are farmers, four are students who help in their parents' businesses. The youngest child is 4 years old and not in school yet.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing her vegetables.

loans.name: Ursula Aydee

texts.es: URSULA tiene 35 años vive en casa propia con su cònyuge y tiene 3 hijos su cònyuge es profesor de arte tambien ejerce  sus trabajaos independientes de dibujos y otros, a la fecha esta preparandose para  dar un examen de nombramiento para su especialidad, su cònyuge tiene una tienda en su propia casa ,tienen experiencia crediticia y buenas referencias personales , solicita dicho credito para gastos personales se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en: Ursula is 35 years old and lives in her own house with her spouse and their 3 children.  She is also an art professor.  She does independent drawings and other works.  To date, she is preparing for a consideration for appointment in a post in her specialty.  Her spouse has a shop at home.  They have good credit history and personal references.  She is requesting the loan for personal expenses, and expresses her proposed capacity and overall a willingness to pay it back.

loans.use: For personal expenses

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en: Rodrigo R. is from the village of Sta. Clara Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 53 years old. Rodrigo is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Rodrigo plants and harvests rice for sale. Rodrigo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per harvest. In 2011, Rodrigo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodrigo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Rodrigo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new tuk tuk (motorcycle) for her husband

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase modern machinery for his land

loans.name: Mrs. Samun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village has seventeen members who have selected Mrs. Samun to be the village bank president.  All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes in order to improve their family’s standard of living. 

Mrs. Samun was born in 1979.  She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she can grow rice and potatoes to support her own family and for sale while her husband is a recycling seller.  Since her husband’s business is doing well, she wants to expand it.  So to improve it, Mrs. Samun is applying for a loan to buy more recycled material for resale.  She is a mother of two children.  One of whom is a student, but the youngest one is 3-years-old.

loans.use: To buy more recycled materials for resale

loans.name: Latoya

texts.en:
LaToya W. owns Prosperous Staffing LLC, a business that provides staffing solutions for call centers and other businesses needing excellent customer specialists.   LaToya has hired a staff with extensive experience in customer service and LaToya herself has experience working in the call center industry.  Their combined experience gives Prosperous Staffing the know-how to be the bridge connecting the gap between employer and employee.  With many companies operating call centers in Houston, LaToya recognized the opportunity for a niche staffing agency that knows the ins and outs of the industry.  

LaToya is using this loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana to purchase business cards, brochures, workers compensation insurance, and to update her business’ website.  When LaToya first opened Prosperous Staffing in 2009, she relied solely on her savings to get the business up and running.  Looking back, she realizes that a lack of financing prevented her from starting the business with enough resources to be effective, which is why she turned to ACCION Texas-Louisiana after temporarily closing her business.   This loan gave her the means to re-launch and aggressively advertise her business.  Having just celebrated the re-launching of her business on May 2, LaToya is running her business full-time and has engaged the help of a part-time recruiter and a part time field worker.  

LaToya credits her parents with giving her the confidence to be a small business owner.  After working for years in Corporate America, she decided it was time for her to create her own opportunity.  LaToya is utilizing the business counseling services offered by the Houston Minority Supplier Diversity Council and the Women’s Business Enterprise Association for networking and instruction in business development.  LaToya’s goal is to establish Prosperous Staffing as the premier staffing agency for call centers in the greater-Houston area.  When the time comes, she will expand Prosperous Staffing to other markets where call centers have a strong presence.   

Check out LaToya’s website at http://www.prosperousstaffing.com

loans.use: to pay for business cards, brochures, workers compensation insurance, and updates to her business' website

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María es comerciante,  vende tortillas, carne de cerdo, y ahora está comercializando ropa, teniendo el propósito de captar más ingresos que ayude con los gastos de la canasta básica como gastos básicos de agua y luz.
Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo de profesión jardinero, atraves de Afodenic ha venido logrando estas mejoras con cuatro ciclos siendo para aumentar el inventario de sus ventas como las mejora de su vivienda.
Hoy con este préstamo hará un sumidero para tener inodoro y lograr mejor higiene, ya que no pasan las agua negras por el barrio. Es por tal razón pagara para que le hagan el sumidero, en donde comprara: bloques, hierro, cemento, para hacer el arranque del sumidero, a si como la compra del inodoro.
texts.en:
María sells tortillas and pork, and now she also sells clothes.  She plans to make more income which will help her with her basic household food expenses and also help her cover her water and electricity bills.

María has the support of her husband who is a gardener by profession.  Through Afodenic, she has managed to make improvements.  Over four loan cycles, she has increased her sales inventory and also improved her home.

María will use this loan to build a sewage drain so that she can install a toilet and achieve better hygiene.  This will mean that sewage no longer passes through the neighborhood.  She will pay some people to build her a sewage drain and will buy blocks, iron and cement.  She will also buy a toilet.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies such as blocks, cement and iron to build a sewage drain so that she can install a toilet and achieve better hygiene

loans.name: Danny Ernesto

texts.es:
EL señor Danny Ernesto, es del departamento de Managua, es un apersona trabajadora debido a que ha sabido llevar el bienestar  a su casa y a logrado a mantener a su familia que tanto adora. 
Es señor solicito su crédito para hacer mejoras en su Vivienda  para comprar materiales de construcción  Como arena  piedra  cemento entre otros y el pago de Mano de obra.
Danny manifiesta que los prestamos que se le han otorgado en ceprodel los a utilizado en hacer mejoras de su vivienda y en gastos personales para el desarrollo tanto para el como para su familia.
texts.en:
Danny Ernesto is from the department of Managua. He is a hardworking man who has known to provide for the wellbeing of his household and has managed to support his family, whom he adores. He requested a loan to make home improvements, to purchase construction materials such as sand, rocks, and cement, and to cover the labor costs. 

Danny indicates that the loans which here granted to him by Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) were used to make home improvements and to cover personal expenses, for his own and for his family's development.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is 31 years old and married by status. Her husband is attached to a fruit selling business. Through his shop, he sells fresh seasonal fruits to his clients at reasonable rates. Parveen is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very caring lady and tries to give comfort to her family with her work. She has given birth to two sons. Both of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband who wants to buy fresh seasonal fruits for the expansion of his business. More variety of fruits will enable him to fulfill the timely demand of his customers and increase his profits. He has been operating this business for the last 15 years. Parveen is hopeful that her husband will be able to improve it further after the loan investment, which will help her family to have a better standard of living.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Parveen.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Adigozal

texts.en:
Adigozal is married and has three children. He has a grocery shop in the central bazaar of Agsu city. 

Adigozal has sold food items for the last three years. His business boasts fresh groceries, reasonable prices, flexible and high-quality client service, and uniqueness and variety of merchandise. 

Adigozal works hard to develop his business and make his business profitable. With two previous loans from AqroInvest CU, he was able to invest in his business and increase his monthly income to 200 AZN.

Adigozal is requesting a loan of 1,200 AZN to purchase an assortment of goods for retail sale and increase his profit. 

We believe that Adigozal, having been a good client for many years, will repay his loan without any delinquencies.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of goods to sell.

loans.name: Soknoy

texts.en:
Soknoy is a silk weaver. Her husband is a hair cutter. Their income is $5 per day. She has three children. Two are studying. 

Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $20 on transportation, $10 on school fees and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy silk to weave and sell. 

She plans to repair her house when she can save enough money. For her children, she will try to send them to study until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy raw silk to weave and sell.

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Sochea has two children, four and one years old. She works in a garment factory, and her husband is a cook. Together, their income is $6 a day. Every month she spends $30 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on rent and $10 on transportation.

Sochea is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. She has a plan to raise pigs to sell when she can save enough money.

Sochea is working hard to be able to send her children at least through high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Sofiya

texts.en:
Sofiya, 50, is a resident of Tup. She is married and has a thirteen-year-old daughter. Sofiya’s husband is a retiree, while she is an experienced salesperson of vegetables and fruit in a local food market. This business idea belongs to her father, who nineteen years ago proposed to finance the business start-up with 3,000 soms. 

Since then Sofiya has gained experience and is capable to take care of complicated issues in a fast way. She works on a daily basis sometimes with the assistance of her daughter. It requires everyday commitment, because demand for food products is constantly high. At the present time the business brings in up to 5,000 soms per month. 

The purpose of Sofiya’s loan is to get a wholesale rate on fruit and vegetables for further reselling. Her biggest wish is to make major furnishings in the house, which she will accomplish when enough profits can be generated. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kanatbek's Group

texts.en:
Kanatbek, 49, is a member of this group. He earns money by transporting passengers from Balykchi to Bishkek and his wife sells fish in the market. Their children are students who study in Bishkek. Kanatbek started to provide transportation services three years ago. This business helped to improve their family’s living conditions. He applied for this loan because he needs additional funds to purchase auto parts. In the future Kanatbek wishes to purchase a big house for his family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Alkhamid

texts.en:
Alkhamid  is 60 years old and lives with his wife and three children. Alkhamid is an animal farmer. He owns sheep and breeds them with the help of his wife. As a rule, Alkhamid purchases the lambs in the central market, feeds them and then resells them at higher prices in the central livestock market. 

Being in this business for 20 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and to generate a stable, considerable income for his large family.
  
His wife, who is a school teacher, helps Alkhamid in looking after the sheep. Alkhamid monthly profit from sheep selling is about 350 USD.

Alkhamid is planning to further develop his business by enlarging the stock and purchasing more sheep. For this purpose, he requests a 1,500 AZN loan that he will spend for the purchase of sheep and lambs and for feed for them. After fattening them up, he will be able to sell them for a more favorable price. Then, Alkhamid will be able to use the profit from his business towards the well-being of his family. 

He has already demonstrated himself as a good client, having successfully completed three loans with a positive credit history.

loans.use: purchase 12 sheep and five lambs.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 42 years old. She is a single mother of two school aged children. Farming is her primary business. She has been in the business for the past two years in Ndunyu Njeru.


She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. This will be her second loan from KADET. She repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use this loan to pay school fees for her daughter. She hopes to be among the leading farmers in the area.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 22-year-old married woman with one child who is still too young to go to school. She has a business selling soft drinks such as mango juice and soda in Buluk in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Victoria requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She wants to build a house with the extra income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more soda and mango juice for sale

loans.name: Boymurod

texts.ru: Боймурод житель района Дж. Руми. Возраст, 54 года. Он женат. Имеет пятерых детей. У него высшее образование. Он окончил Таджикский аграрный Университет. На сегодняшний день Боймурод зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов бычков.
texts.en: Boymurod lives in the J.Rumy district.  He is 54 years old, married and has five children.  He has a higher education and graduated from the Tajik Agricultural University.  Today, Boymurod earns a living by breeding cattle.  He has been involved in this business for 10 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of several heads of bulls.

loans.use: to buy several heads of bulls

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Barbara” del distrito, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene  28  años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo.  Cuenta con estudios secundarios.

La señora Amelia trabaja desde hace dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles dinero que invirtió en el negocio de venta de tejidos, tales como combinaciones y chompas de todo tamaño. 

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en la compra de materiales como quince bolsas de lana de diferentes colores para la confección de de prendas de vestir, trabaja junto con su esposo en el negocio, la mercadería lo vende en la localidad de Juliaca, Ilave.

La señora desea tener más capital para comprar materiales y producir más prendas, tener una casa en otro sitio, le gusta del Banco Comunal la puntualidad de los pagos, el ahorro y la ganancia.
texts.en:
Amelia is a member of the Communal Bank "Santa Barbara" of the District and Province of Yunguyo in the Department of Puno.  She is 28 years old, married, and has a son.  Her highest level of education is secondary school.  

Amelia has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the past two years.  Her first loan was for 500.00 Soles; money that she invested in the business of selling knitwear, such as sweaters of all sizes and combinations.

With this new loan of 1,500.00 Soles, she plans to invest it in the purchase of materials such as fifteen bags of different-colored yarn to make different pieces of clothing.  She works alongside her husband and they sell their articles of clothing in the locality of Juliaca.  

Amelia hopes to have more capital to purchase more materials and produce more items and own a home in another area.  She likes the communal bank, the punctuality of the payments, the savings, and the earnings.

loans.use: to purchase fifteen bags of different-colored yarn

loans.name: Patricia Angelica

texts.es: Patricia Ángelica es una mujer consagrada a su familia, por lo que trabaja con gran dedicación, vende ropa usada se siente afortunada por tener y un trabajo en el cual puede estar al frente de su hogar y manejar sus propios horarios. Con la ilusión de tener un progreso continuo Patricia quiere comprar mercancía al por mayor para generar más utilidades e insumos como pantalones, vestidos, trajes y faldas ya que tiene ciertos pedidos de clientes con tallas grandes. Es por eso que solicita un crédito para invertirle a su microempresa.
texts.en: Patricia Ángelica is a woman who is devoted to her family and so she works with great dedication.  She sells used clothing and feels fortunate to have a job in which she can lead her household and manage her own hours.  With the hope of making continual progress, Patricia would like to buy merchandise wholesale in order to make more profits.  She will buy supplies such as pants, dresses, suits and skirts as she has some large orders from her customers.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her micro-business.

loans.use: to buy pants, dresses, suits and skirts

loans.name: Sahr Hilton's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a secondary school in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 4,700,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan using their monthly salaries.

Sahr Hilton is the leader of this group of teachers. A native of Koidu, the 49-year-old is married and has five children – three in primary school and two in secondary school. Sahr has been a professional teacher for 24 years. He has requested this loan in order to invest in agriculture and in a small scale business.

loans.use: to invest in agriculture and in a small scale business

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es: Con su anterior crédikiva Xiomara compró queso, productos de panadería que vendió y se encuentra muy satisfecha porque logró reinvertir este nuevo capital. En la actualidad se prepara para recibir su nuevo credikiva, el cual invertirá en queso especialmente, porque se acercan las fiestas de fin de año, temporada de gran repunte en sus ventas, debido a que las familias aumentan el consumo de este producto, que es la base de la preparacion de deliciosas comidas y es usado tambien como pasabocas de las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo. Su mensjae a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente:" Gracias por apoyarme y mi retribución  será cancelar en forma puntual la obligación."
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Xiomara bought cheese and baked goods which she sold. She is very satisfied because she was able to reinvest this loan. She is now ready for her next Kiva loan. She will invest it particularly in cheese because the New Year is coming up, and she always has very good sales at this time, because families consume cheese more at this time of year. This is because cheese is the base for many delicious foods, and it is also used as finger food during Christmas and New Year's parties. She has the following message for Kiva lenders:
"Thank you for supporting me. In return, I will be punctual with my repayments."

loans.use: to buy cheese and baked goods.

loans.name: Palomas Group

texts.es:
Palomas es un grupo solidarios muy activo, que se esfuerza por conseguir lo que quiere, conformado por 7 mujeres muy responsables que con mucha dedicación lograron hacerse de cada uno de sus negocios para se esa manera apoyar a sus familias y salir adelante. Se encuantran en su primer ciclo y sus reuniones estan ubicadas en el municipio de General Escobedo, Nuevo León. Ellas decidieron poerle ese nombre al grupo, ya que les gustan las palomas. 

Carmen es una joven, independiente y responsable mujer de 32 años de edad, vive felizmente en unión libre con su pareja y sus 4 hijos de 7, 9, 13 y 14 años de edad, todos estudian y le ayudan con lo que pueden. Carmen se dedíca a la venta de repostería, entró a un concurso de panadería en el DIF y así inició su venta y conforme iba vendndiendo su mercancia comenzó a comprar mas moldes y materiales los cuales utiliza para preparar mas postres.

Con las ganancias que tiene Carmen, no solo eleva su negocio, si no que también ayuda a su familia con los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus hijos, ya que uno de los mejores sueños que desea que se cumplan es ver a sus hijos que sigan luchando por una mejor educación y lleguen a tener un gran puesto en un futuro.

Carmen desea progresar en la vida y una de las mayores metas que le gustaría cumplir es tener una panadería y hacerse de mucha clientela, para que la gente disfrute de sus panes y pasteles.
texts.en:
Palomas is a very active mutually supportive group, which strives to achieve what it wants. It consists of 7 very responsible women who, with a great deal of dedication, managed to grow their business in order to support their families and get ahead. They are in their first loan cycle and their meetings take place in the municipality of General Escobedo, Nuevo León. They decided to use this name for their group as they like doves [palomas].

Carmen is a young, independent and responsible 32 year old woman. She lives happily in a common-law marriage with her partner and 4 children of 7, 9, 13 and 14 years of age, all of whom study and help her in what they can. Carmen makes a living selling confectionery. She entered a baking competition in the DIF [Mexico's National System for Integral Family Development] and so started her sales. As she sold her goods she started to buy moulds and materials which she uses to prepare more desserts. 

With the earnings that Carmen has, not only does she improve her business, but also helps her family with the household expenditures and her children's studies. One of her biggest dreams that she wishes to see fulfilled is to see her children continue to strive for a better education and that they obtain a great job in the future.

Carmen wants to progress in life and one of the greatest goals that she would like to achieve is to have a bakery and attract many customers, so that people can enjoy her breads and pastries.

loans.use: to buy more materials for preparing desserts.

loans.name: Tamemsu New Site Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tamemsu Newsite” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking for a loan of 500,000.00 SLL, for each, in order to expand their businesses. 

The leader of this group is Mamah. Mamah is age forty-nine; she was born in Magburaka town where she is currently residing together with her husband and four children, one of whom is in college. For twenty years now, Mamah has been a businesswoman. She sells cooked foo-foo (food made out of cassava roots) and fire-woods. With this loan, she will buy bags of raw foo-foo and fire-woods in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of raw foo-foo and fire-woods in order to expand her business.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a single young man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as an honest and principled man. He has been running a barber shop for the last two years. In addition, David also sells khat to increase his income. He has one employee. His business challenge is lack of enough funds for improving the barber shop. He will use the loan KES 20,000 to buy a shaving machine. His dream is to expand his business and employ people.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun, 62, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for over 20 years, have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice, and fattening up cattle to use in their farming selling them for a profitable price. All of her children are employed in a garment factory. 

In order to improve her family's livelihood, Sun is requesting a loan of USD1200 to run a new business by renting a store in the market so her children can sell electronic equipment. By doing so, her children would generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to rent a store in the market so her children can sell electronic equipment

loans.name: Maombi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Déborah, membre du groupe d’affaire Maombi est entrepreneur, âgée de 47ans. Elle est mariée à un enseignant, mère de 10 enfants  tous scolarisés et vendeuse de farine de manioc. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  11 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit va  lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 10sacs de 50 kilos de farine de manioc qu'elle va marchander. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un dépôt de stockage pour une bonne survie de sa famille. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son assistance en crédit aux femmes pauvres économiquement active.
texts.en:
Déborah is a member of the Maombi Group. She is an entrepreneur, and 47 years of age. Déborah is married to a teacher, and is the mother of ten children, all of whom attend school. Déborah is a cassava flour merchant and has just completed her 11th loan cycle with Hekima.

Déborah's new loan will serve to supply her with ten 50-kilo sacks of cassava flour, for which she will haggle. Déborah's ambition is to open a storage depot so that she can ensure a good life for her family. She thanks Hekima for their loan assistance to poor women who are economically active.

loans.use: to purchase ten 50-kilo sacks of cassava flour.

loans.name: Lourdes Patricia

texts.en:
My name is Lourdes B., and I have had my pulperia(restaurant/market) for six years, it is located in one of the largest commuter zones in my city, which is a stop for buses and taxis. My sales have increased and I need to supply my business in order to offer a variety of products like rice, beans, milk, eggs, bread and other items, which are the most sold, to offer my clients what they need.

Loan Use: Purchase confections, milk, bread, sodas, rice, beans, sugar, butter, coffee, and other items.

Me llamo Lourdes B., tengo una pulperia desde hace seis años, esta ubicada en una de las zonas de mayor transito en la ciudad ya que es parada de buses y taxis. Mis ventas han aumentado y necesito abastecer mi negocio para ofrecer variedad de producto de consumo como arroz, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan y otros que son los mas vendidos y de esta manera brindarles a mis clientes lo que ellos necesitan.

loans.use: Compra de confites, leche, pan, refrescos, arroz, frijoles, azucar, manteca, cafe y otros.

loans.name: Alik

texts.en: Alik is a resident of Sumgayit city. He is 25 years old and is not married. Alik is engaged in buying used cars, repairing them and re-selling them in a special car market. He has been doing this for almost three years. Alik applies to Normicro for his first loan with the purpose of increasing his working capital in order to develop his business further.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Aipopo

texts.en: Aipopo has raised seven children. She still provides financial support to much of her family via her business selling coconuts. Most of what Aipopo sells at the local market is pre-husked coconuts, which command a slightly higher price than the other coconut products. She is confident that her business has a future, and she says that she prays for another twenty years of being strong enough to carry on the operation.

loans.use: Buy tools

loans.name: Maria Esther Verónic

texts.es:
Maria Esther is divorced and has an 8 years old daughter and a 10 years old son. In order to support her family and because she had no one else to help her, Maria decided to start her own business selling fruit in which fortunately she had succeeded and has grown in the last 2 years since she opened it. The love for her children and her wish to give them a good education has motivated her all this time .

In order to keep on growing, Maria is requesting a $475 loan to buy merchandise, as well as to offer better service and keep her clients preference; she will repay the amount in 6 months. This family needs your help; their well being is in your hands. Help them!

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Esther es divorciada y tiene una hija de 8 años de edad y un hijo de 10. Ante la necesidad de obtener los recursos para sostener a su familia y no tener la ayuda de nadie para cuidar de sus hijos, Maria decidió emprender su negocio de frutería en el que afortunadamente le ha ido bien y ha hecho crecer desde hace dos años que inició. El amor hacia sus hijos y el deseo de darles una buena educación han motivado a Maria todo este tiempo.

Para poder continuar creciendo, Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, así podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio y conservar la preferencia de sus clientes, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Esta familia necesita mucho de tu ayuda, en tus manos esta su bienestar ¡Apóyalos!.

loans.use: To Buy merchandise

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
My name is Martina and I am a merchant. I am a single mother and a senior citizen. Thanks be to God, I feel strong and can work. I have a small business selling new clothing and shoes, located in the city center. I have been working in this business for several years, and it generates income to cover the different expenses of the home and to pay other obligations incurred. Thanks to the income from this business, I have improved my home bit by bit.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Martina, soy comerciante, madre soltera y de la tercera edad, gracias a Dios me siento fuerte y puedo trabaja, tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva y calzado, ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para l cubrir los diferentes gastos en el hogar tambien para cumplir con los compromisos adquiridos. Gracias a las utilidades de este negocio he mejorado poco a poco mi vivienda.

loans.use: To buy skirts, blouses, sandles, women's and girl's pants, and children's clothing

loans.name: Nyoman Sadwathi

texts.id:
Sadwathi has a rice stall business. She has been doing it to increase family's income. Her husband's income is Rp700,000.00 (about US$77)/month. That amount is certainly not sufficient. Daily expenses are about Rp30,000.00 (about $3.30), rent for house and food stall. Although her 2 children are independent, she has to work. The rice stall business gives her gross profit of Rp100,000 (about $11). The distance she has to take between her house and her rice stall is about 2 km. Her rice stall location is quite strategic. One factor is that the road is quite busy. That fact is also supported that the food Sadwathi sells are liked by her customers. Also the many building laborers working around Sadwathi's food-stall. Raw materials prices are quite high, but this mother relies on capital to buy enough raw materials. The to be obtained loan would be used to add to her capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sadwathi memiliki usaha warung nasi. Dia menekuni usaha ini untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga. Penghasilan suaminya per bulan Rp 700.000,00. Uang sejumlah itu tentu saja masih belum mencukupi. Biaya hidup per hari Rp 30.000,00, kontrakkan baik untuk rumah maupun untuk warung nasinya. Walaupun kedua anaknya sudah mandiri, dia harus bekerja. Usaha warung nasinya ini memberikan keuntungan kotor per hari mencapai Rp 100.000,00. Jarak yang harus dia tempuh dari rumah menuju warung ± 2 km. Letak warung nasinya cukup strategis. Salah satu faktornya jalur yang melewatinya cukup ramai. Hal tersebut juga didukung oleh makanan yang dijual Sadwathi diminati oleh pelanggan. Hasilnya penjualannya pun sangat bagus. Hal ini ditambah dengan banyaknya buruh bangunan yang bekerja di sekitar warung Sadwathi. Harga bahan baku sekarang memang cukup tinggi, tapi ibu ini memanfaatkan modal yang ada untuk membeli bahan baku yang cukup. Pinjaman yang dia peroleh akan dia manfaatkan untuk menambah modal yang sudah dia miliki.

loans.use:
To buy rice, vegetable and spices

Membeli beras, sayur, dan bumbu.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a small entrepreneur owning a pharmacy shop. She is married to Hashimu Abdallah and has two children ages 4 and 6. Her husband works with the Tanzania Railways Authority. Aisha is one of the best entrepreneurs who is focusing in the Morden business. This is the third loan to request she has made to SELFINA. Aisha is asking for a loan of USD 875 to buy an air conditioner for cooling the office. She is proposing to repay in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy an air conditioner

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Mr. A. is 56 years old, married and has two children. He is engaged in cattle-breding. Tahir has ten years experience at this business. He is requesting a loan of $700, with which he plans to buy an additional male calf and increase the number of the cow he owns.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Teles António

texts.pt:
Teles António L., bearer of ID number 110378439S, is married and has 5 children. He joined the program on October 3, 2006, and is now on his 3rd loan. He is requesting 6000 MT, to be repaid in 6 months. He intends to invest the money in purchasing goods and repairing his house. He is a hard worker.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Teles António L., portador do BI nº110378439S vive maritalmente tem 5 filhos entrou no programa a 3/10/06 agora esta no 3º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 6000 a pagar em 6 meses o valor vai investir na compra de bens e reforma da sua casa. ele é trabalhador

loans.use: Purchase goods and repair home

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr A. Kokou is 36 years old, married and father of three children. He has been the owner of a woodworking workshop for 7 years that supplies him with the majority of his income. The current loan will allow him to acquire a planning machine to improve the quality of his work.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr A. Kokou est âgé de 36 ans , marié et père de 03 enfants. Il est propriétaire d’un atelier de menuiserie depuis 7 ans qui lui procure la majorité de son revenu . Le présent crédit lui permet d’acquérir une raboteuse afin d’améliorer la qualité de son travail

loans.use: Purchase of a planning machine

loans.name: Yarlin Yohanna

texts.es:
Yarlin Yohanna lives in the municipality of Achuapa in the city of León. She has an agricultural business planting seeds. Yarlin Yohanna is married and has three children. She and her husband share the responsibility of providing their children with the education they deserve.

One of the main problems she faces, is the fact that in the locality where she lives, there is no source of electric power, due to distance and low economic resources of the region. In order to overcome this situation, Yarlin Yohanna purchased a solar panel, and therefore, she seeks the support of CEPRODEL, which she hopes will provide her with a loan that will allow her to finish paying the solar panel , which she and her family use to get their at their humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer,

Yarlng Johanna es habitante del municipio de Achuapa en la ciudad de León teniendo su negocio de agricultura dedicándose a la siembra de semilla en su localidad. Es madre casada y con tres hijos a su responsabilidad que junto con su esposo se esfuerzan constantemente para brindarles la educación que ellos se merecen.

Una situación problemática que ella atraviesa es que en la localidad donde ella vive no se cuenta con energía eléctrica por factores de distancia y bajos recursos económicos para establecer la energía. Al querer superar esta situación ha adquirido un panel solar y para ello muy responsablemente busca apoyo en CEPRODEL para obtener un crédito que le permita cancelar la deuda del panel y así aprovechar la energía eléctrica para su iluminación en su humilde hogar de habitación.

loans.use: To pay solar panel loan

loans.name: Truong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trương Thị Bằng, 46 years old, lives with her husband, 46, and two children, 18 and 20. She sells charcoal. Her family has been in this business for 5 years now. Two or three times a week she buys wholesale coal then resells to those restaurants in the area. It is hard work but makes her happy and independent. Her motto is honesty in business that earns her a lot of customers. Her average monthly income is about 150-170USD. She’s been with the TYM Fund for 7 years. She would like to apply for a loan of 625USD to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Trương Thị Bằng năm nay 46 tuổi, còn chồng chị 47. Anh chị có 2 cháu, 18 và 20 tuổi. Công việc chính của gia đình chị Bằng là bán than. Gia đình chị làm nghề này được 5 năm. Cứ 2 đến 3 lần 1 tuần, chị mua buôn từ các cơ sở sản xuất than về bán lại cho các hộ gia đình và cửa hàng ăn trong vùng. Công việc tuy vất vả nhưng chị Bằng luôn rất vui khi đồng tiền kiếm được thực sự do công sức mình làm ra. Trong bán hàng chị luôn giữ uy tín nên có đông khách quen đặt mua hàng. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình từ 150-170USD. Sau 7 năm tham gia Quỹ sử dụng đồng vốn hiệu quả, vòng này chị làm đơn xin vay 625USD để mua thêm hàng phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh.

loans.use: Buy wholesale charcoal to resell

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen J., wife of Mr. J., has been living in Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 15 years. She lives in a three room brick house with her three daughters and two sons. For the last 15 years, her husband has been running a poultry farm. She would like to apply for a loan to invest in her husband’s poultry farm business.

Her loan group members include: Parveen B., who wants to expand her food business; Irshad B. wants to make carpets; Karam B., who wants to repair her rickshaw; Razia B. wants to purchase and sell medicine. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana B. sells fruits and vegetables from her home in the municipality of Sandino. She has had this business for 20 years, and thanks to her hard work she has been able to improve her economic situation and quality of life. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell and continue to grow her business.

La dama Juana Bermúdez se dedica a su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en su propia casa de habitación en el municipio de Ciudad Sandino donde atiende a sus clientes para ofrecerles sus productos.

Desde hace 20 años se dedica a esta labor y por medio de esta ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y ha permitido que su hogar salga adelante.

La necesidad que actualmente atraviesa es que necesita la compra de las verduras y frutas para comercializarlas y por ello busca el apoyo en CEPRODEL para obtener el crédito para realizar su compra y así salir adelante en su negocio.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE FRUITS AND VEGETABLES TO SELL

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena Z. N. is a 29 year old single mother. She completed her studies through high school. She has one young daughter who is studying in primary school. She lives in the district of Victor Larco in Trujilo, La Libertad. She and her former husband had started a business printing t-shirts. A friend invited her to join the Communal Bank LAS PALMERAS from which she received her first loan for 300 Soles. She invested this money to purchase paints. Later she had problems with her husband and when they separated she decided to go into another business. Now she sells household goods from a small store run out of her home. She also participates in the local milk consortium in her neighborhood. With a loan for 800 Soles, to be repaid within 6 months, she plans to add stock to her store and to pay her daughters tuition. Her goal is to open a minimart to earn enough to support her daughter since she doesn’t have any support from her ex-husband. In spite of her problems she is happy because she is managing to improve her life.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora María Elena Z. N., es madre soltera, tiene 29 años, estudió secundaria completa, tiene 01 hija menor de edad que está estudiando el nivel primario; vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. Al comienzo la socia y su esposo se dedicaban a los estampados de polos. Por la invitación de una amiga ingresa al Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS” en este banco comunal recibió su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 este dinero fue invertido en la compra de pinturas, luego tuvo problemas con su esposo y al separarse decidió cambiar de negocio; ahora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa. También participa en el vaso de leche de su barrio. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses, tiene pensado surtir la bodega y pagar la movilidad de su hija. Tiene como meta, tener un minimarket para poder ayudar a su hija, ya que no tiene el apoyo de su esposo, pero a pesar de los problemas ella se siente contenta porque está logrando salir adelante.

loans.use: To purchase supply of household goods for resale.

loans.name: Vanesa Isidora

texts.es:
Vanesa is 36 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She is married with two children, 3 and 15 years old. Her husband helps her in her clothing sales business. Vanesa sells cosmetics, clothing and shoes. She has been in this business for four years. She started the business with her own savings and the help of her husband. She has overcome all of the difficulties she has encountered, including the low sales that sometimes come from increases in prices, and cause clients to buy few products. She is in the process of improving her home. The loan will be used in the construction of a wall which will give the family more security.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Vanesa tiene 36 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 3 y 15 años de edad. Su esposo le ayuda en el negocio de la venta de ropa. Vanesa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ropa y zapatos, tiene cuatro años de estar en las ventas la cual inició con fondos propios y con ayuda de su esposo, y han superado todas las dificultades como las ventas bajas que algunas veces resultan con la inflación de los precios y esto hace que los clientes adquieran pocos productos. Está en proceso de mejora de su vivienda y el préstamo será usado para infraestructura en la construcción de una pared para su vivienda y así lograr más seguridad para su familia.

loans.use: Construction of a cement wall for her home.

loans.name: Amina's Rabi Tupe Kheri Group

texts.en:
Amina is 32 years and married with 9 children between 5 months and 15 years old. She has been a clothes and snacks seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8AM to 6PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Amina is now looking for a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with clothes sales, snacks sales, a retail shop, and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding her current stock.

loans.name: Anna H.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Anna H. M. from Tukuyu. She is married with three children, between the ages of 14 and 18. Anna has been running a stand for selling fish since 1990, selling fish from Mwanza and Kigoma. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Anna currently earns about 40 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to buy fish in bulk for reselling. In the future, she plans to open a shop for selling fish by wholesale. Anna thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk for reselling.

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es:
Delicia pertenece al Banco Comunal Cruz de Motupe del distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Es madre soltera de tres hijos y tiene 34 años de edad. Piensa que su mayor logro ha sido recuperar a sus hijos, comenta que ellos se encontraban a cargo de su papá, así mismo manifiesta que ha comprado sus cosas para poder ver mejor a sus hijos y eso le he traído mucha satisfacción personal. 

Es vendedora ambulante de prendas de vestir, de zapatos, carteras o bolsos, todo lo que le pueda ser útil para el negocio nos afirma. Compra desde la ciudad de Lima y Trujillo y lo vende caminando y utiliza su casa de almacén. La mayor dificultad que tiene es que ha sufrido robos cuando ha viajado a realizar sus compras, tan es así que incluso le ha sido y aún le es difícil recuperarse del último robo que sufrió que la obligó a empezar de nuevo. Ahora menciona que se encuentra tranquila junto a sus hijos. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200 el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en arreglar su casa, debido a que desea tener en mejores condiciones a sus hijos.
 
A Delicia le gustaría capacitarse para mejorar en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Delicia belongs to the Motupe Cross Communal Bank in the district of Independence, Huaraz province, department of Ancash. She is a single mother of three children and is 34 years old. She thinks that her greatest success is getting her children back, who were in the care of their father. She has bought things to better take care of her children and this has brought her a lot of personal satisfaction. She is a street vendor of articles of clothing, shoes, wallets and bags, everything that would be useful for business, she says. She buys these in the city of Lima or Trujillo and sells them on the street or from her home. The greatest problem she has had is that she has been robbed when she was traveling to make her purchases. It has been and still is difficult for her to recover from the last robbery that forced her to start from square one. Now she says that she is happy spending time with her children. With this loan of 1,200 soles ($400), which she will repay over 6 months, she will invest in the improvement of her home, as she would like her children to live in better conditions. Delicia would like to prepare herself to improve her family life.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in home improvement

loans.name: Christophe

texts.en:
Greetingz from Christopher H. from the northern province of Rwanda! Christopher H. is 31 years old with 4 children.

This entrepreneur has a stand in Musanze market where he sells clothes and shoes for men, women, and children.

Christopher is requesting a loan worth 515 000 Rwf to increase his working capital and be able to make enough money to pay his children’ school fees next year. This loan will be repaid in 8 months

loans.use: Increase his working capital

loans.name: Faalaeiau

texts.en: Faalaeiau T., 24, is married and has one child.  She has many years experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public two days per week. Her husband is working and helps her out in financing the business when it is slow.  Faalaeiau has had one previous loan with SPBD, which is her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.  She plans to purchase fertilizers, weed killer, seeds, knives, and taro tops to start a taro plantation.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, weed killer, seeds, knives, and taro tops for a taro plantation

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
La señora Aurelia es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, sector Dos, de la comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 43 años de edad, y esta al cuidado de cuatro hijos, casada y posee estudios de primaria incompleta (quinto de primaria).
Trabaja desde hace año medio con el MMR, ella se dedica al engorde y venta de ganado en las ferias ganaderas, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, que los invirtió en la compra de alimento para su ganado.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 3 cuotas,  comprará alimento balanceado para su ganado, medicinas y semillas, y así podrá obtener un buen peso de su ganado y a su vez obtener buenas ganancias; ella agradece a Manuela Ramos por su confianza, ya que le permite ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of the "Sacuyo" communal bank in Dos, in the town of Sacuyo, district of Acora, Puno province. She is 43 years old and cares for four children, is married and her primary studies are incomplete (fifth grade). She has worked with MMR for a half year. She works at fattening up and selling livestock at the livestock markets. Her first loan was for S/. 500 new soles, which she used to buy feed for her livestock. With this loan for S/. 800 new soles, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will buy balanced feed for her livestock, medicines and seeds so that they can reach a good weight and she can have good earnings. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for their trust in her, which has allowed her to help her children with their education.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy feed and medicine for livestock. Buy seeds.

loans.name: Vilma Margoth,

texts.es:
A partir de las seis de la tarde hasta la medianoche, Vilma Casimiro se dedica a vender anticuchos en la puerta de su casa desde hace un par de años. Antes de vender anticuchos vendía frituras puesto que consiguió un carrito ambulante donde cocinar. En este negocio estuvo solos dos años hasta que el carrito se descompuso. Además la competencia en la venta de frituras era cada vez más alta.
Vilma empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos variados, especialmente cosméticos por catalogo. Su esposo, quien trabaja como chofer contratado de una reconocida clínica, y ella cubren los gastos del hogar. En unos años ella quisiera abrir un restaurante si se le presentara la oportunidad.
texts.en:
From 6 in the afternoon until midnight Vilma Casimiro sells kebobs from the door of her home – something she has done for six years. Prior to selling kebobs she used to sell fried food as she obtained a small cart where she could cook. She was in this business only two years when her cart broke. In addition, the competition in fried food continued to grow. Vilma began working selling various products, including cosmetics through a catalogue. She and her husband, who works as a contracted driver for a well-known clinic, cover the household expenses. In a few years she would like to open a restaurant if she has the opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and materials for her business

loans.name: Jessenia Esther

texts.es:
La Sra. Jessenia D. se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda en la cual vende varios productos de uso personal, tiene 2 años de tener su negocio el cual le ha dado mucho para poder sostener a su familia, ella tiene 2 hijos que son lo mas importante para ella en esta vida, ella tiene todas las ganas de superarse y salir adelante con sus hijos, pero para eso necesita hacer crecer su negocio y esto lo podra lograr con mucho esfuerzo.
ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y poco a poco hacer crecer su negocio. por tal razon esta solicitando el dinero.
su meta es llegar a tener un mercadito bien surtido y grande.
texts.en:
Jessenia D. is a businesswoman and owns a small store in which she sells a variety of personal products. She has owned her business for two years and has been able to support her family with her earnings. She has two sons who are the most important part of her life. She has the desire to overcome her obstacles and help her sons. In order to do so, she must expand her business, which will require a lot of effort.

Jessenia is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise so she can begin expanding her business. Her goal is to have a well-stocked store with a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of deodorants, gel, creams,  nailpolish, nailpolish remover, sodas, churros, sweets, hairdye, nail files

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon tiene 30 años, es soltero, y tiene 1 hijo.  Su negocio tiene una antiguedad de 5 años y vende maiz (en granel y tambien molida), queso, frutas y verduras. La inversión del préstamo, lo destinó a la compra de maiz, ya que en esta época es lo que presenta mayor demanda en su negocio. Los ingresos que le genera este negocio, le permite cubrir los gastos propios de su familia además de los gastos del colegio de su hijo.

Al inicio comenta que fue muy duro y difícil iniciar este negocio ya que no contaba con capital y  las primeras inversiones realizadas fueron gracias a sus ahorros y con la ayuda de sus padres quienes les facilito un pequeño capital.

En este emprendimiento Ramon tiene tambien cuenta con el apoyo de su madre que en horas de llevarle a su hijo a la escuela es la encargada del negocio y que lo hace con gran responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Ramon is 30, single, and has one son. He has had his business for 5 years. He sells corn (in bulk and also ground), cheese, fruit, and vegetables. He will use the loan to buy corn because it is now in the greatest demand in his business. The income generated by his business allows him to cover the family expenses as well as the school expenses for his son. In the beginning it was very hard and difficult to start his business. He did not have resources. The first investments made were thanks to his savings and help from his parents who gave a little money. In this endeavor Ramon also counts on his mother’s support. When Ramon takes his son to school, his mother is in charge of the business. She does this in a very responsible manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn
