loans.name: Mehrichon

texts.ru: Торговля в семье Мехрихон традиционный вид занятия. Ее старшая дочь тоже занимается торговлей и содержит свою семью, а сама Мехрихон несмотря на свои 55 лет тоже торгует тканями. За товаром она ездит в Худжанд на китайский оптовый рынок. Торговля занимает основную часть времени Мехрихон, но что поделаешь раз это основной доход семьи. Мехрихон подала заявку на КИВА и собирается приобрести новый ассортимент тканей.
texts.en:
Sales are a traditional occupation for Mehrichon’s family. Her older daughter also sells products and supports her family and Mehrichon herself despite her 55 years also sell fabrics. She travels to Khujand to the Chinese wholesale market to purchase her products. The sales business takes up the majority of Mehrichon’s time, but what can she do since it is the main source of income for her family. Mehrichon applied to KIVA and plans to acquire a new assortment of fabric.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase fabric assortment

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Phượng Nguyễn Thị (311950277) is a 34 year-old female living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Phượng owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector, operating a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community. Phượng has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1995, Phượng joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Phượng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Phượng is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 11th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Phượng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud C., 62, lives in the village of Pines, Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental, where she is married and has 12 adult-aged children. To make a living, Salud owns and operates a "sari-sari" or retail store which primarily sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. to the local community. Salud has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Salud joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from the organization and is now requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari." This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. Salud plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mansurbek

texts.ru: Джаборов мансурбек проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 29 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Мансурбек более 9 лет занимается растениводством. Он в основном выращивает бахчевые и рисовые растения. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения для посева.
texts.en:
Mansurbek J. lives in the Rumi region. He is 29 years old, married and has two children. For more than nine years, Mansurbek has been involved in growing vegetables. He is most involved in growing melons and rice plants. The client is requesting a loan in order to purchase mineral fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Isabel Celestina

texts.es: La señorita Isabel C. tiene 21 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios tejedora, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 telares, habita junto a su Mamá, ella y sus Mamá se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un empleado para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío 2do Palemop, Aldea V., del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Isabel C. is 21 years old, single and a weaver by trade. She makes typical women’s clothing in her workshop equipped with two looms. She lives with her Mamá, who also weaves, and they have one employee. She has six years experience weaving at her home at Caserío 2do Palemop, in Aldea V., in the Totonicapán region of Guatemala.
Her customer demand has risen, but her current economic situation is making it difficult for her to increase her capital. This is why she has come to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. She plans to purchase raw materials that will enable her to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicraft materials

loans.name: Justina Angelica

texts.es:
Justina es socio del Bancomunal Los Sureños.
Justina es conviviente tiene 29 años, cuatro hijos de 12, 10 y 4 años que están estudiando en el escuela estatal y su ultimo hijo  de 9 meses.
Justina no termino la escuela, por que salio embarazada, se puso a trabajar como empleada en casas, junto su plata y sus hermanos que están en el negocio de  moto-car., le animaron que se comprara una moto-car el cual lo da en alquiler, pero ella sigue trabajando limpiando  en casas.
Desde que Justina esta en Finca, aprendió a valorar el trabajo, el dinero, aprendió aprovechar las oportunidades de trabajo que se le presenten. 
Justina necesita un préstamo de  800 soles, para la compra de llantas para su moto-car.
 El sueño de Justina  es seguir trabajando hasta que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the Communtiy Bank "Los Suenos".

Justina lives with her partner and she is 29 years old. They have four children, aged 12, 10, and 4 years old. They are all attending the community school. The youngest is a baby of 9 months.

Justina did not complete her schooling because she became pregnant. She started work as a maid in private homes. But she saved her money and because her brothers have motorcycle taxis they encouraged her to buy one and rent it out. She did so but she is still providing maid services.

Ever since Justina has been with Finca (Kiva Field Partner) she learned the value of work and the value of money. she learned to take advantage of opportunities that present themselves.

Justina requires a loan in the amount of 800 soles to buy new tires for her motorcycle taxi.

Justina's dream is to keep working to see her children grow up to have a career.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new tires for her motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Tojidin

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Тоджидин торгует мужской одеждой на базаре. У него качественный товар, поэтому имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Тоджидин кредитуется у нас с 2008 года. Он успешно закончил два предыдущих займа и теперь запрашивает новый займ для закупки летних мужских одежд.

loans.use: Закуп летних  мужских одежд.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona S. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Chona is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Chona owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling  products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Chona has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Chona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Chona from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pepe

texts.es:
Pepe es chofer de trufi 88 del sindicato Eduardo Abaroa, grupo Correcaminos, su esposa es comerciante tiene un puesto en la ceja ciudad de el Alto, siendo así su fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos que depende de ellos; los hijos todavía se encuentran estudiando y no pueden ayudar o colaborar con los quehaceres de la casa; vive en casa propia ubicada en la Zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de motor para su movilidad y así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos, o al menos mantenerlos.
 
Es sexto crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Pepe.
texts.en:
Pepe is the driver of minibus #88 for the Eduardo Abaroa trade union and a member of the group “Correcaminos” (Roadrunners). His wife is a businesswoman who has a vending post on the outskirts of the city of El Alto. Their incomes support their three dependent children, who are still studying and not able to help with the household chores. Pepe and his family live in their own home in the district of Llojeta in the city of La Paz.

His loan will be used to buy a motor for his vehicle. This will help him improve his earnings, or at least keep them at the same level.

This is Pepe’s sixth loan with IMPRO. His evaluation indicates he is qualified for a loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a motor for his taxi

loans.name: Delivina

texts.en:
Although she is 67 years old, Delivina T. still wants to continue to be independent and self-sufficient. She is married to Basilio, who is 69 years old and retired. They have nine grown children - all of whom have their own families. Delivina and Basilio live in the town of Moises Padilla in the province of Negros Occidental.

Delivina owns a food vending business that sells "Inasal" - charcoal grilled barbecued meats like hotdogs, pork strips, beef tocino, and even solidified pork blood, which is a popular native delicacy. Her food stand is quite popular in her neighborhood and has enabled her to save enough to establish a general store adjacent to her house. She also makes and sells banana cue. Banana cue is made of fried bananas on skewers that are coated with sugar and cooked until the sugar caramelizes.

The income her business generates helps her cover household expenses. Over the years, she has been able to pay to build her house and to create a savings for future security. Although she's been in this business for over 20 years now, she still enjoys managing the daily activities. She now earns about PHP 9,000 per month. Her last loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon was her 19th one and she borrowed PHP 19,500, which she used as additional capital for her business. This time around, she intends to borrow PHP 22,000 for her 20th cycle to reinvest further into her food vending business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her food vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of boards to sculpt

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is forty-two years old, a widow with three children. Her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been hawking cosmetics in the neighborhood to her loyal clients. She says that the sale of cosmetics is very lucrative, and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to adequately support her family, especially her kids' education.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn and her husband Ronald have four children, the eldest being ten years old. They operate a rice farm and duckery to support their family. Evelyn is a member Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and would like to request a loan of 12,000 Php to support her business. This loan will be very helpful to provide supplies necessary for the farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Nuris Narda

texts.en: Nuris, a single 27-year-old single woman with one child, sells clothing on foot, travelling to the city of Chinandega to buy merchandise and then going to the smaller city of Somotillo to sell. Her business started 11 years ago when a friend loaned her money at a low interest rate so that Nuris was able to buy a bit of merchandise to begin selling clothing.  As she gained established clients she has been able to offer them credit lines. In this way Nuris has been able to provide for herself, and she says that the loans form Fundación León 2000 have greatly helped her. The challenge that she faces is a lack of working capital, but she nonetheless dreams of having her own cart so that she can become more established as she travels to visit clients.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Faasaveve

texts.en:
Faasaveve T. is 36 and married with 5 children (ages 6 - 17).  She owns a business venture, selling traditional handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Faasaveve has many years of experience in this business.  Faasaveve needs a loan of WST $1000 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 tala or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2006, Faasaveve joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faasaveve's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faasaveve T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.8 out of 3
Level of Education:                         2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Luchie

texts.en:
Luchie E. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 22 years old. Luchie is single. To make a living, Luchie owns & operates a retail store where she sells ready to wear items like shirts, shoes, jeans, and more in the local community. Luchie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luchie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luchie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Luchie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Luchie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mr. Suon N. is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He has a few physical laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses. 

He has another partner in his wife, who appears in the picture above. She sells meat to people who eat it with beer or wine in the village. 

Mr. Suon N. has three children, one of whom is married and lives independently, and the other two are students and dependent on him. Mr. Suon N. has been paying money for taxis to get to work because he doesn't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, he is applying for a loan to purchase a new motorcycle, which will allow him to commute to his work location.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata Koné est âgé de 32 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec ses deux enfants et son époux dans le quartier Badialan,  de la ville de Fana, deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Madame Fatoumata, en plus de sa profession d’enseignante, excelle dans les activités de fabrication de boissons non alcoolisées notamment les jus de fruits. Fatoumata est très sollicitée, appréciée et jouit d’une grande notoriété.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel, après avoir correctement  remboursé le  premier.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter,  20 sacs de zaban, un sac de sucre, des paquets de colorants, d’arômes, des sachets plastiques et deux sacs de dah rouge. 
Il s’approvisionne  essentiellement à Fana et quelques fois à Bamako (capitale du Mali). Elle fait vendre ses jus de boissons non alcoolisées, de façon ambulante dans les différents quartiers de la ville à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille et le reste investi dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Koné is 32 years old. She lives in a monogamous household with her husband and two children in the Badialan neighbourhood of Fana, in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali. In addition to being a teacher, Mrs. Fatoumata excels in the production of non-alcoholic beverages, particularly fruit juices. She is in high demand for her products, well appreciated and enjoys an excellent reputation. With the desire to satisfy a growing number of customers, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso MFI where she is now requesting a second loan, having correctly reimbursed the first one. She will use the loan to buy: 20 bags of saba concentrate (a local fruit variety), one bag of sugar, packages of food coloring, flavour extracts, plastic bags and two bags of red roselle concentrate. She gets her supplies mainly from Fana and sometimes Bamako (the capital of Mali). She sells her non-alcoholic fruit juices as an itinerant vendor in the different areas of town, to a customer base of both men and women. She hopes to reach an average monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, which she will use to assist her husband deal with family expenses. The remainder will be reinvested in her activity.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for fruit juices

loans.name: Aminalah

texts.en:
Aminalah is the son of S.. He lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 54 years old and has four children who are in school. He wants to take out a loan for his business, as he needs to buy different kinds of beverages for his shop. He has a general store in which he sells different kinds of things. He wants to expand his business and buy more materials, especially the things that are more in demand. At the same time, he wants to attract more clients.

He is happy that there is a nice process that can solve entrepreneurs’ problems. He wants to make his shop larger to help with his families. So he is very happy about this process of small loans in Afghanistan and wants to thank everyone, especially the Kiva lenders around world.

loans.use: To expand and progress his business

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 45 years old, married to a commercial driver, and blessed with seven children. Her children attend school, and this gives her joy. She is a friendly, happy woman who is determined to excel in her business and family life.
Patience is a trader who makes a living by selling iced fish in Benin City. She also sells foodstuffs, such as tomatoes, peppers and onions. The biggest challenge in her business is a lack of funds and she hopes to overcome the challenge. Patience is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more iced fish to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more iced fish to sell

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana G. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Feliciana is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Feliciana owns & operates a business selling rice in the local community. Feliciana has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Feliciana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Feliciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Feliciana is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Feliciana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Amirkhon

texts.en: A. Amirkhon is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 35 and lives with his wife and three children. Amirkhon has a grocery store where he sells foodstuffs. The business is very successful but needs some investment of capital to increase its daily turnover. That's why Amirkhon has applied to IMON International for a loan of 3000 US Dollars. This loan will allow him to buy bigger amounts of goods for resale to better provide for his family and save more money to be able to get married. With your collaboration he’ll be able to crystallize his dreams in a short time. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase larger amounts of foodstuffs

loans.name: Kasi

texts.en:
Mrs. Kasi B. (pictured above), age 33, and her husband, Mr. Sot Sok, age 32, have been married since 1998 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. The family is living on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Kasi is a tailor while her husband is a motor taxi driver. She is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase wood material to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To purchase wood material to renovate her house.

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um N., 27, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its clay and ceramic products.

N. raises pigs and grinds rice grains for an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband buys pigs and cows for resale, earning an income of USD 6 per day to help cover the family expenses.

N. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more pigs and cows to expand her husband’s business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

N. appears in the photograph with her husband. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and cows for her husband's business

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Maria integra el Banco Comunal Brisas y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones y el incentivo al ahorro.
Maria es casada y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando, Maria tiene un cafetín en la base policial de la ciudad, en donde vende comida, golosinas, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hija. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de gaseosas y galletas.
Su mayor deseo es que sus hijos tengan un negocio de donde vivir y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Brisas (Breezes) communal bank; what she enjoys the most are the training sessions and the savings incentive. María is married and has 8 children, three of whom are in school. She has a small coffee shop in the city’s police station where she sells food, sweets and fruit every day; her daughter helps her. She will use the loan to buy cookies and soft-drinks. Her greatest wish is that her children have a business to support themselves and to enlarge her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks and cookies.

loans.name: Graciella

texts.es:
La  señora Graciela de 44 años de edad, es separada, tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales los mayores están casados  y ella  vive con dos hijos una de 19 años y otro de 10 años.
   Ña Graciela  se inició con el trabajo de vendedora ambulante  aproximadamente en el año 1.990, ella era ama de casa pero con la necesidad de ayudar a su familia y poner su granito de arena con el dinero que tenia ahorrado compro varias mercaderías y empezó a dedicarse a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad.
   Actualmente lleva un total de 20 años en el rubro y abarca la zona de San Joaquin y sus alrededore, saliendo todos los dias de su casa a vender sus ropas. 
   Solicito el crédito para la compra de camperas en cantidad por que tiene varios pedidos.
   La cliente tiene proyectado alguna vez  poner un salón exclusivo para venta en un lugar estratégico, y espera un futuro mejor para nuestro país con mucho trabajo y progreso.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de camperas de varios tipos de cuero, jeans, lana.
texts.en:
Mrs. Graciela is 44 years old, separated, and has four children, the grown ones are married and she lives with two of them, one 19 years old and the other 10. Mrs. Graciela started in approximately 1990 as a street vendor. She was a housewife but because of the need to help her family and the desire to contribute, she bought merchandise with the money that she had saved and started to sell basic items. At this point she has been in this business for 20 years and covers the San Joaquin and surrounding areas. leaving her house every day to sell her clothing. She is requesting the loan to purchase jackets because she has various orders for them. This customer is planning to someday open a shop at a strategic location and expects a better future for the country with hard work and progress. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of jackets of various types; leather, denim, wool.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jackets of  leather, denim, wool.

loans.name: Sabougnouman  7 Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe Sabougnouman  7 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fatiana, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide,   le petit mil et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le premier a été bien remboursé.
KOBA D. compte utiliser son prêt pour les frais de labour,  de semence, d’engrais, d’herbicide,  de sarclage et de petits équipements agricoles en vue d’exploiter environ 1 hectare  d’arachide et de haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20.000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Sabougnouman 7 group are married women, who average 43 years of age with an average of three children each. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Fatiana, one of the villages of the prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of better organising their activities at the beginning of the winter season. The crops they cultivate include peanuts, pearl millet and beans. They are on their second farming loan, and the first was paid on time. Koba D. is planning to use her loan to pay for labor costs, seeds, fertilizer, weedkiller, hoeing and small farming equipment, with a view to farming around a hectare of peanuts and beans. The produce, once harvested, is sold in the towns of Dioïla and Fana, to a customer base made up of men and women. The women are expecting to make an average profit of 20,000FCFA at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor costs, seeds, fertilizer, weedkiller, hoeing and small equipment

loans.name: Mungunhuu

texts.en:
Mungunhuu B. is 21 years old and lives with his parents and siblings in their own house in Hovd province, western Mongolia.

Mungunhuu operates a transport service in his town which he began in 2006 after purchasing a small car. He has found success with his business and has gained much experience as a driver over the years.

In 2009, Mungunhuu provided transport services to tourists and earned 3,000,000 MNT so now, with the earnings, he wants to purchase a bigger car for his business. He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a newer and bigger car for his transportation business.

Mungunhuu is an honest and hardworking person who is known by his customers for his good character. For the future he hopes to continue to provide a quality and efficient transportation service.

loans.use: To purchase a newer and bigger car for his transportation business

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Our CCT* Community Partner, Nerissa D. L., 41, finished a degree in Midwifery and is married to Emmanuel D. L.. They have three children. They live in Pasay City, south of Manila. Emmanuel works as a train operator. Their three children are all in school: with one in college, another in high school, and the youngest in elementary.

Nerissa finished midwifery but chose to do a business related to transportation. They presently own vehicles which are for hire, mainly by companies. Nerissa also has a small business in rag-making. Altogether, the net earnings of the family per month amount to P11,960. 

Nerissa is applying for a loan of P12,000, which she plans to use to register two of her vehicles to be officially used in business. She would also use the loan to improve the conditions of the vehicles by changing the color and adding some accessories.

At present, Nerissa finds the daily collections from the business difficult. Sometimes, the vehicles are penalized for violation, which adds up expenses. At times, the vehicles get damaged and need repairs. However, Nerissa still hopes and believes that God has destined her for a greater purpose. She dreams to own a bigger business with more vehicles that would cater to many more companies in Metro Manila and beyond. She also hopes that her rag-making business will increase in sales. She aims for these breakthroughs in business because, at the bottom line, she aspires to buy her family their own house and lot.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Towards vehicle registration and maintenance.

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.en:
M. Rahimjon is 32 years, married, and has one child. He owns a shop in which he sells spare moped engine parts, a business he has been running for the last 2 years. The income he earns allows him to support his family including his parents, too. To meet his customers’ constantly growing demand, Rahimjon would like to increase his shop’s capacity. The profits from these sales will allow him to continue to improve his family's living conditions. The loan will greatly improve Rahimjon’s income and his family's living standards.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for mopeds

loans.name: Hung

texts.en: Hung N. D. is 55 years old. He  is living with his family in Dong Anh town. Joining our credit program in 2006, he has opened a shop that sells  embroidery pictures and handicap products. This kind of business is very new, so his shop attracts a lot of customers. Currently, he wants to  borrow 7,194,000 VND to invest in his shop. Micro-finance is really suitable with his business.

loans.use: to invest in his shop

loans.name: Annma Rachel

texts.es:
Annma Rachel López  Velásquez
 Annma Rachel es de 46 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos varones y  cuatro  mujeres, es  comerciante (venta de ropa típica), en la actividad tiene más de  seis  años de experiencia, solicita su tercer crédito, para compra de mercadería  (cortes típicos), es una inversión rentable lo cual beneficiara a la solicitante para poder pagar el  sin ningún problema.
texts.en:
Annma Rachel López  Velásquez
Annma Rachel is 46 years old, is married and has three sons and four daughters. She is a merchant (sells traditional clothing) and has had more than six years of experience in this field. This will be her third loan to buy merchandize (traditional styles) it is a good investment which will benefit Annma since she will be able to pay without any problems.

loans.use: To buy merchandize

loans.name: Mutwa

texts.en: Mutwa N. is 43 years old and married to a casual laborer; they have five children aged between 8 and 24 and they hope to give them a good education to the university level. Mutwa N.'s business is located at Nguni, Mwingi and is served by Thika Branch, located in a region of Kenya known for the production of pineapples. She has been selling vegetables to the local people for the last two years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that she has to walk long distances to hawk the vegetables. However she works very hard to keep her business going well. She is using her loan of KES 10,000 to buy more vegetables to sell. She hopes to be a horticultural farmer to increase her stock of vegetables and expand her business. She describes herself as hardworking, innovative and responsible.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two brothers. He has been working in a restaurant since 2008 to earn income. With his business income, he is able to help his father with the family expenses. 

As is common among young Lebanese men, he has a job and is pursuing education at the same time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for his university education fees. He is studying computer engineering and this is his second year. 

In the future, he is planning to start his career in a computer company to gain experience and be able to help his parents with his income. In the long term, he is planning to open a computer shop in his town.

loans.use: to pay for his university education fees

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 29 years old. She is married and has three children who are between three and seven years old. Her two older children go to school. 

Her husband is a motorcyclist.  Josephine sells beans and sorghum. She has been in this business for about two years.  She needs this loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. 

When her business makes profit she will renovate her house, and hopes to also buy a motorbike from that profit. She says that her business is successful because it facilitates her basic family needs. She would like to have a large stock of food stuff in the future.

loans.use: To buy beans and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Yanjinlham

texts.en:
Yanjinlham N. is 61 years old. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and grandchild in their own house and yard in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Yanjinlham operates a vegetable business to support her family. She sells a variety of vegetables out of a rented stall at the Han Talst trade center. She has been engaging in this trade for past eight years and has gained significant experience. After many years of running this business, she has gained many permanent customers. She has been planning to expand her business and to start renting one more stall where she will sell a variety of dairy products to supplement her earnings. Her daughter-in-law helps with her business by working as a salesperson in the stall. 

Yanjinlham is a hardworking businesswoman and says, "I want to have a work place for my children". 

She is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan in order to increase her working capital for her business.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es: La señora Eloisa V. Gutiérrez desde hace 15 años se dedica al comercio el cual tiene un negocio de abarrotes llamado “Miscelánea Dariela” donde ofrece todo refrescos, frituras, dulces, lácteos y producto enlatado. Eloisa requiere de un préstamo para comprar mas mercancía y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Eloisa V. Gutiérrez has managed a grocery business called “Miscelánea Dariela” for 15 years. She offers soft drinks, chips, candy, dairy products, and canned goods.

Eloisa needs a loan to buy more merchandise so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El señor es soltero, vive en el barrio San José de la ciudad de Pilar.
Vive en casa de sus padres, posee su taller propio de motocicletas en el mismo lugar, donde atiende a sus clientelas, brindando sus servicios profesionales.
Solicita el crédito para compras de repuestos que utiliza en  su negocio.
Cuenta con una antigüedad en el ramo más de 2 años, brindando sus buenos servicios a sus clientelas.
Cliente manifiesta que con la ayuda del crédito de la Fundación Paraguaya se ha fortalecido  más su microempresa y  agradece por los buenos servicios que les brindamos.
texts.en:
Walter is single.  He lives in the San José neighborhood of the city of Pilar in his parents' home.  He owns his own motorcycle repair shop in the same neighborhood where he serves his customers, providing his professional services.

He is requesting this loan to buy the spare parts that he uses in his business.  He has been in the business for more than 2 years, providing a good service to his customers.  He tells us that, with the help of a loan from Fundación Paraguaya, he has further strengthened his small business and he is grateful to the institution for the good services with which we provide him.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ar:
احمد في عمر 54 سنة متزوج وله 2 ولدان يحب عائلته يعمل في نقل عام له في عمله 25 سنة يسعى جاهدا الى تحسين اوضاعه المادية
والاجتماعية فهو يريد لعائلته المستقبل الجيد وتأمين العيش الكريم وتحسين وضعهم الاجتماعي والمادي يريد من خلال طلب 
قرض له من المجموعة الى صيانة الفان خاصته حتى لا يضطر الى التوقف عن العمل لأن الفان هذا هو المعيل الوحيد له ولعائلته
يحلم دائما بالتجدد والتطور له زبائن يقصدونه من السواح يتميز بالصدق والامانة
texts.en: Ahmad is a 54-year-old husband and father of two who loves his family and who works hard to provide a secure future for them. For the past quarter century, Ahmad has been working in taxiing tourists around. Ahmad’s work is marked by responsibility and integrity. He would now like to ask for a loan from Al Majmoua to have maintenance work conducted on his van, which is the sole source of income for him and his family.

loans.use: To have maintenance work done on van

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Pedro Pablo se dedica a una panadería. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, pues esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que ha sido una fuente de ingreso para su hogar. El siempre habla con sus vecinos y público en general para saber si la calidad de sus productos les proporciona satisfacción, con el paso del tiempo ha podido mejorar su experiencia en este negocio. Este crédito que solicita actualmente es para la compra de harina, huevos, mantequilla, queso, entre otros.
texts.en: Pedro Pablo is in the bakery business.  He has been working in this sector for over 11 years but this is the first time he has been involved in the financing aspect making  this the main source of income for his household.  He always talks to his neighbors and general public to make sure the quality of his products is to their satisfaction.  With time he has been able to improve his expertise.  He plans to use the loan to buy flour, eggs, butter, cheese and other ingredients.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Merarie

texts.en:
Merarie B. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old. Merarie is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Merarie raises a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Merarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Merarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Merarie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Merarie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is married with 7 children. She lives with her family in Aurora, in the province of Agusan del Sur, where she has a farming business. She works very hard to provide for her family and is asking for this loan to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.  

In the future, Liezl hopes to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Baktygul Saitova's Group

texts.en:
Baktygul S., 41, is the leader of this group. A resident of Nookat, a sunny, small town in Osh province in southern Kyrgyzstan, she has been employed for a rather long time in a regional military unit along with her husband, Nasirali. The couple has two children who are financially dependent on them. Being in the military for most of his life, Nasirali imposed upon his children a deep sense of devotion to and defense of the Motherland. It wasn’t surprising when their son decided to join the national army.

Baktygul is extremely proud of her children and hopes to provide the best conditions for their future education and employment. She is involved not only in her work in the military forces but also maintains the household well.

Baktygul keeps cattle and enjoys running a dairy. Six years ago she also started cultivating a small piece of land that they own and discovered the soil was very fertile. There always is a high demand for her fall harvest of vegetables and fruits, which helps Baktygul satisfy her family’s basic financial needs.

This spring Baktygul has grand plans to expand the variety of her crops, so she is in need of more funds than usual. She hopes Kiva will help her purchase mineral fertilizers. With her profits she plans on increasing her herd of cattle and purchasing a house.

About Mol Bulak:

This loan is being presented by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 28 years old.  She has a common-law husband and 1 child.   Evelyn has an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.  She has been raising pigs for 5 years.  

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid 9 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.  She has requested a new loan of PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Evelyn would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is currently in a business of selling green vegetables. She is 40 years old, married with 5 children, all of whom go to school. Mary borrowed a loan to stock more green vegetables to sell. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: stock more green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Magaly Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María José se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Magaly, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 16 y 8 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por tres  ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos ha ido mejorando dia a dia su vida.

Realiza este crédito para construir una pequeña cisterna en su casa parar que nunca les falte el agua, este liquido vital tan importante y que no hay por este sector, nos cuenta que en esta parte de la ciudad el agua no llega a través de tuberías sino que tiene que comprala y almacenar en pequeños tanques y al comprar así el agua no les dura mucho y le sale muy caro, por eso quiere construir su cisterna para comprar por tanqueros completos y así poder tener agua suficiente y a mejor precio para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar cemento, hierro, ripio, arena y otros materiales necesarios para poder llevar a cabo esta obra.
   
Sus sueños son tener buena salud y arreglar su casa lo mejor posible.
texts.en:
The María José communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo’s Picoaza Parish, a place renown for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional feasts of Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the joy of its residents.

We met Magaly, 40, here.  She’s married and has two children who are 16 and 8 years of age; both go to school.  Her husband is a merchant.   She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and she likes it because the loans have been improving her life day to day.

She is taking out this loan to build a small cistern in her house so that they’ll never lack water, this so vital liquid that is not available in this sector.  She tells us that in this part of the city water does not arrive through pipes but rather it must be purchased and stored in small tanks.  Having to buy water this way is expensive and the water doesn’t last very long.  Because of this she wants to build a cistern so that she can buy water by the tank truck full and thus have sufficient water at a better price to improve her quality of life.

She will use this loan to buy cement, iron rods, gravel, sand and other materials needed to carry out this project.  Her dreams are to be healthy and to fix up her house the best way possible.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba, who has been educated up to the junior high level, is married to a cleaner and has two children. Aba sells tubers of cassava and bags of charcoal in Kwaprow near Abura in Cape Coast, using her income to support her children's education. Aba says the loan from Kiva will help her to buy more bags of charcoal for distribution. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal for distribution.

loans.name: Tariq

texts.en: Tariq is a 34-year-old married man from Al Ashrafieh, Jordan. Tariq is a butcher. He is requesting a loan of 2,000 JOD to perform maintenance on his shop and expand his project.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his shop and expand his project.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John  is 27 years old, married and blessed with one child. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last three years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming. John learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan. He is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and to educate his children.

John's hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and to buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home. He is a particular man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Rosas Rojas, es oriunda del cantón Paute pero vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica y natural,  por su variada gastronomía y la calidez de su gente.

Doña Rosa tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 28, 26, 23 y 22 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan solo para sus gastos personales, su tercera hija es casada e independiente y su último hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es operador de maquinaria pesada, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora Rosa  se dedica al comercio vende todo tipo de ropa, esta actividad la desempeña  hace un año y trabaja en sus ventas los días domingos todo el día. Los demás días se dedica la cría de cuyes.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños para surtir su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener un local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a member of the communal bank "Rosas Rojas" (Red Roses).  She is originally from Paute Canton but currently lives in the city of Cuenca.  The city is known for its architectural and natural beauty, its varied gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Doña Rosa is 43 years old, married and has 4 children ages 28, 26, 23 and 22 years old.  Her first two children work to support themselves, her third is married and lives independently, and her youngest attends a school in the city.  Doña Rosa's husband is a heavy machinery operator.  Through their hard work, she and her husband have been able to build their own home.
 
Doña Rosa makes her living in the clothing business.  She sells all types of clothing.  She started this business one year ago.  Her merchandise is available for sale all day long on Sundays.  On the other days of the week, she dedicates her time to raising guinea pigs.  

This is Doña Rosa's third loan, and she is going to invest in the purchase of pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing to stock up her business.
 
Doña Rosa's goal is to have a small store in which to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Yut

texts.en: From the Baray District of Kompong Tom Province, Mrs. Yut, age 50, owns and operates a small kiosk shop located inside a secondary school where she sells various cakes to the students. She normally makes US $3 in profit each day to support the family's daily expense. A few sources of family income come from her husband who is a professional teacher. Aside her selling business, Mrs. Yut has been planting a rice crop as an annual activity. Mrs. Yut will use the loan that she is borrowing to purchase fertilizers and seeds for farming. She has five children, one of whom works at a local organization while the other four are still learning in public school. She hopes to use the rest of the fund to pay for school fees for her children in the new semester.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds and to pay for school fees for her kids.

loans.name: Ogab

texts.en: Ogab is 44 years old.  After retiring from the military, he opened his own stationary store selling office stationary and some computer parts. He also has a copy machine for those who want to copy some papers or documents. The store has been successfully running for six years. Now Ogab has applied for this loan in order to redecorate the stationary store to be more organized.

loans.use: To redecorate his stationary store

loans.name: Ilimkan

texts.en:
Ilimkan, 60, is a member of this group. She is married and is a proud mother of seven children, the youngest of whom is a college applicant. The main source of income for the family is cattle breeding. For almost 16 years Ilimkan has been buying young calves, taking care of them, and reselling them after they reach a certain age. She is considered to be the founder of this kind of business in her village, Taldy Suu. Therefore, all her neighbors address her when they need useful advice in the techniques of cattle breeding. The business was started with an initial capital of 16,000 soms and generates about 3,000 soms monthly. Ilimkan hopes to give her youngest son access to a high quality education and help him pay the tuition. Therefore, she plans to increase her efforts in running her business. The purpose of the loan is to purchase two calves for further breeding and reselling. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 45 years old, married and has for the last 10 years earned a living by running a poultry farm in Shanzu, Mombasa. She has been a KADET client for some time now and is applying for her second loan, which she will use to buy more chicks and feed for them to eat. She plans to to use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. Her goal is to become a very successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed for them to eat.

loans.name: Alirio

texts.es: Alirio de 38 años vive al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos de 7 y 14 años. Allí tiene un negocio donde prepara y vende jugos de naranjas, arepas, empanadas, patacones, deditos y buñuelos. Su horario de trabajo es desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde de lunes a domingos, su competencia es poca y sus clientes están conformados por transeúntes, de la ciudadela 20 de Julio, comunidad que combina espacios comerciales, formales e informales, escenarios deportivos, multifamiliares, casas, conjuntos de apartamentos y el negocio de Alirio esta es justamente la vía mas transitada. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y diariamente y sus compras también son de contado y su frecuencia es diaria. En su negocio trabaja con su esposa y el 100% de sus ingresos provienen de esta actividad. Su meta mas adelante es adecuar el local donde muy pronto se trasladará, en un sitio cercano al actual. Mientras Alirio trabaja para conseguir sus sueños, maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor al 24,5%, una rotación de inventarios diaria, indicadores a partir de los cuales proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y auguramos una exitosa inversión de su credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará,   naranjas e insumos para la preparación de sus fritos, una cava, un termo, y hará reparaciones a su carricoche  de jugos, desde el cual hace todo el despliegue de ventas de su inversión.
texts.en:
Alirio, 38, lives in the south part of the city with his spouse and two children who are 7 and 14 years old.  He has a business there where he makes and sells orange juice, arepas [stuffed turnovers], turnovers, fried banana chips, fried cheese sticks and fried dough.  His work schedule is 7am to 5pm Monday through Sunday.  He has little competition and his customers are passersby in the 20 de Julio neighborhood, a community that combines both formal and informal commercial spaces, sports venues, multiple unit apartment buildings, houses, apartment complexes and Alirio’s business is located precisely on the busiest street.  His sales are cash and daily and his purchases are also cash and also daily.  He works in the business with his wife and 100% of his income comes from this activity.  His goal for later on is to furnish the locale he plans to move into very soon; it’s a place near the current one.

While Alirio works toward making his dreams come true, he manages a profit margin on sales of no less than 24.5% and a daily inventory turnover rate, indicators from which we can project potential growth and augur a successful investment of his Kiva loan which is the second financing he’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and that he’ll use to buy oranges and ingredients for his fried food snacks, a keg, a thermos and he’ll do some repairs on his fruit juice cart which is what he uses for all his sales.

loans.use: to buy oranges and ingredients for his fried fast foods, a keg, a thermos and he'll do some repairs on his fruit juice cart.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Channy, 27 years old, is a garment factory worker who earns $3 per day. Her husband is a driver and earns $5 per day. The couple has one child who is one year old. Every month, Channy has to spend $63 on food, $10 on electricity, $12 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy potatoes to sell with her relatives. She plans to buy more potatoes to sell when she can find a good market.

loans.use: to buy potatoes to sell.

loans.name: C2945 Tumenyane Group

texts.en:
Lucie is 37 years old and is married. She has six children between the ages of 4 and 16 years. She is the president of a group called “Tumenyane.” She is in the middle on the right side. Lucie sells clothes. She employs one person to help her and has been working for two years. 

Lucie and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more clothes like skirts, pants, shirts, etc. to resell. With the profits from the loan, Lucie and her team would like to satisfy the basic needs of their families, reinvest in their businesses and start saving for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is 58 years old and married. He is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. Jorge operates a fishing boat to catch fish. He and his wife work together to sell his catch at the market. Jorge works hard to improve his business and his family's living conditions. He requested this loan to purchase fishing nets and repair his pump boat. This will help Jorge continue earning money from his business.

In the future, Jorge hopes to have another source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and repair his pump boat

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes D. 54 años D. edad, vive en su casa propia, tiene hijos independientes, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola,  ganadera y artesana.

Mercedes se dedica desD. hace 5 años a la crianza y comercialización D. aves D. corral (exclusivamente pavos), su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior D. su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo los pueD. ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga pueD. solventar los gastos D. su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado y realizar algunos arreglos en su corral para sus animales, una vez que se engorden sus aves los venD. a los diferentes mercados D. su zona, con la finalidad D. que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más dinero para tener una mejor calidad D. vida.  Mercedes es una persona trabajadora y dedicada que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante, en especial que sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 54 years old. She lives in her own house, and her children are already independent. Her house, which lacks basic utility services, is located in the district of TambogranD. in the department of Piura. Typical activities in this area are farming, ranching and handicraft production. 

For the past 5 years, Mercedes has worked raising and selling domestic birds (exclusively turkeys). The enclosure for her birds is located behind her house, and she feeds them balanced feed and natural grains. Once they reach their optimal size, she can offer them to her customers, and with the income she obtains from this, she is able cover her household expenses. 

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 Peruvian new soles to buy balanced feed and to carry out some repairs to her animal enclosure. Once her birds are fattened up, she sells them at the various markets in her area, with the aim of obtaining a better price and thus having more money in order to have a better quality of life. Mercedes is a hard-working and dedicated person, and the only thing she wants is to help her family get ahead in life, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and repair the pen where she keeps her turkeys.

loans.name: Reyna Margarita

texts.es: Reyna Margarita tiene la actividad de pulpería ya hace bastante tiempo, está ubicado en su vivienda, a ella le va muy bien porque tiene muchos clientes por el buen servicio que brinda, inicio porque su Mama se encargaba de realizar las compras fue por su esposo que juntos decidieron hacerse cargo de este negocio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, pan, galletas, refrescos, sopas, papel higiénico y huevos. Es una persona dinámica con ganas de superación su deseo es el de mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna Margarita has had a grocery store for some time now; it’s located in her house and she does very well because she has many customers thanks to the good service she provides.  It started because her mother used to do the purchases and then she and her husband decided to take charge of the business.

The loan will be used to buy basic grains, snacks, bread, cookies, soft-drinks, soup, toilet paper and eggs.  She is a dynamic person with a strong drive to get ahead; her wish is to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Baraka C Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Baraka C Group in Western Kenya!

In the recent 2011 season, Peter had a good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Peter was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on one acre of land. Peter takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. With income from maize sales, Peter will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

Peter is the facilitator of Baraka C group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.  Like the majority of people in this part of Kenya, the members of Baraka C Group are farmers who rely on maize for yearly food security and income. In 2012, the members of Baraka C group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Peter and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jitegemee Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Jitegemee Group in Western Kenya!  Mary is the facilitator of the Jitegemee group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mary takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had a very good maize yield harvesting eight bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Mary will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Jitegemee group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Pedro es un hombre muy trabajador cuenta con 59 años de edad y dice que su trabaja le gusta mucho, está casado con la señora Dalila, con quien tiene 3 hijos de los cuales ya los 3 están casados y tiene su vida aparte, el es pescador desde hacen 20 años, el se encarga de sacar los pescados y su esposa los lleva a vender al mercado del pueblo vecino.
Don Pedro dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar un poco más a su esposa con los gastos de la casa y con la educación de sus hijos, también para tener una mejor solvencia económica y calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de material de trabajo como: tarrayas y carnada, para continuar con sus actividad.
El tiene una meta para su negocio, dice que desea hacerlo crecer muchísimo, ya que quiere construir un pequeño local, para poner su pescadería y así tener una mejor producción y ventas, ya que contara con mejores ingresos.
Esta muy agradecido con los donadores de kiva y FRAC, por todo el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando, ya que gracias a esta ayuda ahora puede continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a hard working man who is 59 years old. He says that he really likes his work. He is married to Dalila, with whom he has 3 children. All 3 are married and have their own separate lives. He has been a fisherman for 20 years. He gets the fish and his wife takes them to the market to sell in the market of a town nearby.
   
Pedro says that he decided to start this activity because he was looking for a way to support his wife a little more with the household expenses and their children's education. He also wanted to be more solvent and have a better quality of life. He will invest the loan he received in buying work materials such as: nets and bait. This will help him continue to do his activity.

He has a goal for his business. He says that he wants it to grow a lot, since he has always wanted to build a little locale to open a fish store and thus have better production and sales, and better income.

He is very grateful to the Kiva and FRAC donors for the support and trust they are offering him. Thanks to their help, he can continue to invest in his business and support his family.

loans.use: to invest in buying work materials such as: nets and bait.

loans.name: Phor

texts.en:
As a responsible mother, Mrs. Phor operates a hog-raising business to generate income. She is 31 years old and has one school-aged child. Her husband manages their rice farming business and takes some free time to act as a fisherman. Sometimes the family experiences financial difficulties due to the high cost of commodities and school fees since her son studies in high school, but with his parents' help, he’ll be able to supplement his needs. 

Mrs. Phor aims to improve her hog-raising business and make it a viable source of income. She is requesting a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy feed, vitamins and breeding livestock to raise. She believes that the loan will help her to improve her business if she works hard and strives harder. In the future, she hopes to make her business grow and become profitable.

loans.use: To buy feed, vitamins, and breeding livestock to raise.

loans.name: Los Mangos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama los mangos  esta conformado por diez integrantes todas mujeres trabajadoras con ganas de salir adelante y  ofrecerles una mejor vida a sus  familias.
Las integrantes de este grupo  nos cuenta que sus vidas van mejorando gracias al apoyo que les ha dado fundación realidad  ya que sus negocios crecen cada día mas.
Una de las integrantes  es la señora Elsa Maribel  de treinta seis años de edad una señora trabajadora y humilde que se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace tres años, ella  nos cuenta que gracias al apoyo de dios a podido salir adelante con su negocio ya que le deja buenas ganancias.
Doña Mari como mejor la conocen sus compañeras de grupo  esta felizmente casada con la señor Miguel un señor trabajador quien se dedica a la siembra de maíz  y ajonjolí.
Ella  pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas ropa para la venta de  niños y de dama  y hacer pedidos de uniformes escolares.
Las otras integrantes del grupo  son:
Carmela – quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Minerva- quien se dedica a la venta de manualidades.
Erica – quien se dedica a la venta de postres.
