Fortunata  Teresa- quien se dedica a la venta de masa,nixtamal y tortillas.
Ausencia- quien se dedica a la venta de materiales para la construccion.
Edith- quien se dedica a la venta ropa.
Teresa- quien se dedica a la venta de postres.
Anayeli- quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
Hortencia- quien se dedica a la venta de pescado.

Le dan las gracias a fundación por todo el apoyo que le han dado para seguir con sus negocios y triunfar en la vida  y aumentar empleos en  sus localidades.
texts.en:
This group is called The Mangos and has ten members who are all working women who want to get ahead and offer their families a better life.

The members of this group tell us their lives are improving thanks to the help that the foundation has given them, honestly, because their business are growing every day.

One of the members is Elsa Maribel who is 36 years old. She is a humble working woman who has been selling clothing for the last three years. She tells us that thanks to the help of God she could succeed in business and that it left her with good profits. Doña Mari, as she is called by the members of the group, is happily married to Miguel, a worker who grows corn and sesame. She asked for a loan to buy more clothing for children and ladies and has orders for school uniforms.

The other members of the group are:

Carmela who is dedicated to the sale of Mexican snacks
Minerva who is dedicated to the sale of handicrafts
Erica who is dedicated to the sale of desserts
Fortunata Teresa who is dedicated to the sale of flour, corn and tortillas
Ausencia who is dedicated to the sale of construction materials
Edith who is dedicated to the sale of clothing
Teresa who is dedicated to the sale of desserts
Anayeli who is dedicated to the sale of clothing
Hortencia who is dedicated to the sale of fish

They give thanks to the foundation for all the help that they have given so they can continue in their businesses and triumph in life and expand employment in their towns.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 31 years old and married with one child who is eight years old. She does dairy farming to earn a living and runs a transport business. She has been in the business for two years and since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to develop her business. She hopes to expand her business to a big dairy farm in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy animal feed and to service her transport vehicle.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and to service her transport vehicle

loans.name: Erdenedalai

texts.en:
Erdenedalai, 31, sells clothes in the outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her family in the slum district. She sells track suits and other kinds of outfits.  She has been running her business for 6 years.  She had started her business with just one stall and now she owns 2 stalls in the bazaar. Her husband works as a driver of a heavy truck on a mine site. 
Erdenedalai wants to increase her business working capital to expand sales volume and to further increase her earnings. Also after a month there will be Lunar Year which is a traditional Mongolian celebration. Demand on clothes will increase notably during those days. The loan Erdenedalai is taking will be dedicated to purchase clothes in a large amounts to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in large amounts to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is a primary banana and sugar cane growing region. She has seven children, and has been doing this work for 25 years.  Her primary income sources are milk and eggs.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Milking my cows.' Her biggest challenge is: 'Treating animals when attacked by pest and diseases.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyalango.'

Rodah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Because their interest rate is low.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'That they give you a loan and you repay with a small interest.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Rodah replied, 'My children will not have to send me money for upkeep since I will have two cows and will be selling a lot of milk.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Rodah owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yessenia Jacqueline

texts.en:
My name is Yessenia V. and I sell shoes, clothes, wallets, perfumes and other items. I have had my business for two years, which helps me settle my family's expenses and studies. Now, by demand of sales, I have to increase my inventory and buy new products, and through which, better our level of living.

Loan Use: Purchase clothes, shoes for children and adults.

Me llamo Yessenia V. y me dedico a la venta de zapatos, ropa, carteras, perfumes y otros. Tengo dos años de tener mi negocio que me ayuda a solventar mis gastos familiares, estudios. En este momento y por la demanda de las ventas que tengo necesito incrementar mi inventario y comprar nuevos productos y de esta manera mejorar nuestro nivel de vida.

loans.use: Compra de ropa, zapatos para niño y adulto.

loans.name: Namig

texts.en: Namig is originally from the Armenian-occupied Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. In 1995 he started his shop with a small amount of money. In 2006 he borrowed $1,650 from the Normicro Baku branch and expanded his business, Now he wants to borrow $1,200 to expand his business further.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and a repair box

loans.name: Fuamata

texts.en: Fuamata used to own a small shop in her village, but she unfortunately had to close it.  Now she needs additional income to support her family and believes that reorganizing and reinvesting in her shop is the means to raise her family’s standard of living.  She joined SPBD to gain access to loan funds so that she pay renewal fees for the business license and re-open her doors with a full product line.  Her husband and her children are all committed to making Fuamata’s venture work. She says that she can count on their help to keep the business in good condition.

loans.use: to renew her business license and re-stock the shop

loans.name: Seyfulla

texts.en: S. Seyfull is 41 years old. He is married and has 4 children. He is the owner of one cow. Since 2001, his small business has been his first source of income for his family.  One cow is not enough to cover all the needs of such a big family. To improve conditions of his life he applied for a 900 USD to purchase one more milk cow.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow

loans.name: María Porfiria

texts.es:
Señora Maria Porfiria is 60 years old and is separated. She has four children already married and working in various jobs. They have given her grandchildren, who are her source of happiness.

Doña Porfiria has had a sales position at the market in her city for 20 years. She is dedicated to selling medicinal products, creams, essences, and natural herbs. She began doing this 22 years ago by offering these products from house to house, but thanks to her efforts she now has a spot at the market.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise in bulk so she can divide it and offer it to travelling sellers. In this way she will grow her economy, and as she says, take care of herself, without bothering her children since she did not have the possibility of saving for a secure retirement.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maria Porfiria tiene 60 años es separada, tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad ya casados y trabajan en diversas actividades, manifiesta que tiene varios nietos que son su felicidad. Doña Porfiria tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado de esta cuidad hace 20 años, se dedica a vender productos medicinales , cremas , esencias, hierbas naturales, empezo con esta actividad hace 22 años y lo tuvo que hacer recorriendo casa por casa para ofrecer sus productos, gracias a sus esfuerzon logro instalarse en el mercado Ella solicita este crédito para comprar mercaderias en cantidad y asi las fracciona y las provee a varios vendedores ambulantes, de esta manera ira creciendo su economia y como ella misma dice autosostenerse , sin molestar a sus hijos ya que ella no tuvo la posibilidad de pagar un seguro jubilatorio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like medicinal products, creams, essences, and natural herbs.

loans.name: Constantino Jossefa

texts.pt:
Contantino's business of selling timber and clothing started doing much better since he joined the credit program, in 2005, and has allowed him to save enough money to get married and start a family. He is the father of a young child, now. His wife, who works as a housecleaner, also helps him in the business. He will use his loan to buy more timber and clothing articles to sell, and hopes to be able to build a brick house for his family in the near future.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Costantino e casado e pai de 1 filho ainda pequeno.Ele casou ha pouco tempo.Ele entrou para o programa em 2005. Foi depois de entrar para o programa que conseguiu juntar dinheiro para poder casar. O negocio esta a correr bem.Ele pensa no futuro construir uma casa com material convencional para sua familia. A esposa de Constantino e domestica. Ela ajuda o marido no negocio. E um casal jovem ainda

loans.use: Costantino will use his loan to buy more timber and clothing articles to sell.

loans.name: Bessi Afiwa

texts.fr:
Widow and mother of two children, Mrs. Afiwa M. was born in Aného February 12th, 1965 and lives in the Adawlato neighborhood of Lomé. She is a retailer of infant and children's clothing at Lomé's central market. Since the death of her husband, she has been struggling to provide for her children alone. As the year-end holidays approach, she is seeking a $1000 loan to stock new clothing and infant supplies in order to satisfy customer demand and improve her income.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Veuve et mère de deux (02) enfants, madame Bessi Afiwa M. est née à Aného le 12 février 1965 et réside dans le quartier d’Adawlato à Lomé. Elle est revendeuse d’habits pour enfants et de trousseaux bébé au grand marché de Lomé. Après la mort de son mari, elle se démerde seule afin de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants. A l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour s’approvisionner en nouveautés d’habits et trousseaux afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et d’améliorer ses revenus.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of children's clothing

loans.name: Leonilda Valladolid Gonzales' Group

texts.es:
Leonilda is 26 and has two children. Celia is 24 and has one child, while Eulogio is 63 and has four children. Leonilda, Celia and Eulogio belong to the Banco Comunal Qory Qaytu which means “Golden Thread” in quechua. Leonilda has sold fish for five years in the Chorro market in the city of Ayacucho, which she learned from her sisters-in-law. Celia has owned a small grocery store for five years. When she started, she had few products but now her business has grown. Meanwhile Eulogio, along with his wife, has run a small grocery store in his house for twenty years. They need loans of 600 soles, 900 soles and 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of seafood, white fish, mussels, sugar, rice, gas, milk, bread, noodles and wine. Leonilda, Celia and Eulogio tell us that through the Banco Comunal, they have learned to save, to be responsible, and to attend their meetings on time. They will use their savings to buy land, increase the capital for their businesses and on home expenses. Their dreams are that their children have better lives and educations and to have family unity.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Leonilda tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Celia tiene 24 años y 1 hijo, mientras que Eulogio tiene 63 años y 4 hijos. Leonilda, Celia y Eulogio pertenecen al Banco Comunal Qory Qaytu que significa “Hilo de Oro”en quechua. Leonilda vende pescado desde hace 5 años, en el mercado Chorro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que aprendió de sus cuñadas. Por otro lado Celia tiene una tienda de abarrotes hace 5 años y, en un inició tenía muy pocos productos pero actualmente su negocio ha crecido. Mientras que Eulogio junto a su esposa tienen una tienda de abarrotes en su casa desde hace 20 años. Ellos necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 900 soles y 600 soles, que serán invertidos en la compra de mariscos, pescado blanco, choros, azúcar, arroz, gaseosas, leche, panetones, fideos, vinos. Leonilda, Celia y Eulogia cuenta que en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, a ser responsables y a asistir puntualmente a sus reuniones. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para comprar un terreno, aumentar más capital a su negocio y para los gastos del hogar. Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una mejor vida, que haya unión familiar, sus hijos tengan una mejor educación.

loans.use: They need loans of 600 soles, 900 soles and 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of seafood, white fish, mussels, sugar, rice, gas, milk, bread, noodles and wine.

loans.name: Finore

texts.en: Finore E. raises cattle in the small northeastern Azerbaijani town of Devechi. She is married with three children and has been working in this business for the last twelve years. She has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit in the amount of $800. She is currently looking for funding so that she can purchase more calves to raise for slaughter and milk production.

loans.use: To purchase more calves for her business

loans.name: Armina

texts.en: Armina is from Blatuša, a small place near the town of  Zenica. She was born in 1972 and her husband has a full-time job. His monthly salary is 486KM. They have one child, 11 years old. This is her second loan in the amount of 1000KM. Armina wants to use it for agriculture. She plants strawberries and she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: Buying strawberries seedlings.

loans.name: Juanny

texts.es:
Juanny is a member of Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, and is located at Asentamiento Humano Juan Zaplana Belliza Mz c Lt 4, in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 39 years old, has 2 children and her husband is a merchant. Juanny invested her first $100 loan from Manuela Ramos in a shop selling goods.

She starts her day at 6am to prepare breakfast for her family, after which whe works in her shop until 5pm.

With this next loan of $900, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy a higher quantity of goods, such as clothes, perfume, shoes, etc.

Juanny is very happy because, thanks to her business, she can support her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juanny pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Zaplana Belliza, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Juan Zaplana Belliza Mz c Lt 4, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años y es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es comerciante. Juanny con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de mercadería.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta mercadería, se levanta a las 6am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dedica a la venta de su mercadería hasta las 5pm.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2500.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: mayor cantidad de mercadería como: ropas, perfumes, zapatos, fantasía fina, etc.

Juanny esta muy feliz, porque gracias al negocio que mantiene puede apoyar a su esposo en cuanto a los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop

loans.name: Jesus Guillermo

texts.es:
Jesus began his business four years ago when he was a student and needed money to pay for school and for his personal expenses. He has always like cars and so he dedicated himself to vehicle repair by opening a mechanic shop. In this manner, he was able to pay for school and his housing expenses.

Now he is requesting a loan of US $500 which he will repay in 6 months in order to purchase tools that he needs for his job. With your support, Jesus will be able to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Jesús empezó su negocio cuando era estudiante y necesitaba dinero para pagarse la escuela y solventar sus gastos personales hace 4 años. Siempre le han gustado loa autos así que se dedico a la reparación de vehículos, abriendo poco a poco un taller mecánico. Es así como puedo costear la escuela y contribuir a los gastos de la casa.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US$500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar herramientas de trabajo que necesita. Con tu apoyo Jesús saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase tools for his job.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran W., wife of Mr. W., has a six-year-old daughter. Her daughter is in kindergarten. Her husband is a laborer and she makes decorative embroidered clothes. She would like a loan for her husband who would like to start his own business of shuttering. From the money she is able to save, she will start a grocery shop in her home.

Her loan group members include: Ramzana Bibi, who wants to buy a fruit cart; Shahnaz B. who wants to start a vegetable business; and Jamila Bibi who wants to start shuttering business. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Invest in a shuttering business

loans.name: Chany An Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chany A. is the group leader of a group of four in Trok Kandal Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Chany A. is currently a wedding planner: she rents out wedding outfits and equipment and she assists the bride and groom during the wedding ceremony. Her husband, Mr. Bunthoeurn Lot, is a pig breeder, and his business is doing very well.

Mrs. Chany A. has asked for a loA. to buy two more pigs and pig food. She is 37 and the mother of five children, all of whom are attending school. Previously, Mrs. Chany A. obtained a loA. from AMK to buy pig food.

loans.use: To buy two more pigs and pig food in order to improve her living condition

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Jose has been a carpenter for 20 years. He has worked for other carpenters in their shops, but he decided 5 years ago to strike out on his own by opening his own shop. He makes all kinds of furniture. His wife helps him with the carpentry. He also operates a car-parking business at his house.

The loans that he's received have been used for working capital. Jose wants to continue working a couple of years, improve his house so that he can rent it out and go live abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

José se dedica a la carpintería desde hace 20 años. Ha trabajado en talleres de otras personas, sin embargo, hace 5 años decidió independizarse por lo que abrió su propio taller en su casa. Él elabora toda clase de muebles. Su esposa lo ayuda en las labores de carpintería. Igualmente, también da servicio de cochera en su casa.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido como capital de trabajo. José quiere seguir trabajando un par de años, mejorar su casa para poder alquilarla e irse a vivir al extranjero.

loans.use: Buy materials for carpentry business.

loans.name: Nicacio

texts.es:
Nicacio M. P. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

"My name is Nicacio M. P.. I am married and have three children. I work as a security guard in a business and my wife is a homemaker. We have the need to install a bathroom in our home since we have very little space within the house and I need to add to it and make it bigger. The walls are in a very bad state, and we believe that it is not very safe for our kids and also we worry that the humidity harms them since it could make them sick."

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

¨Mi nombre es NICACIO M. P. soy casado y tengo 3 hijos yo trabajo como guardia de seguridad en una empresa y me esposa es ama de casa, tenemos la necesidad de instalar un baño de nuestra vivienda ya que tenemos muy poco espacio adentro de la casa y necesito amplearme y hacerlo mas grande las paredes están en muy mal estado creemos que no es muy seguro para nuestros hijos y también les perjudica mucho la humedad ya que pueden enfermarse

loans.use: Install a bathroom.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami I. is a 53-year-old farmer who sells dairy products in an Internally Displaced People's settlement, Bilasuvar.  He is married and has two sons. From the time he was young  he learned from his parents how to run a livestock business. During this long period, he become one of the major producers of agricultural products in the area where he lives now. 

But life in these regions is getting harder and prices for goods are increasing. The income Nizami had for last year is not enough this year and he's trying to find the best way to increase his income so his family can live in better conditions. For this purpose he has applied for a loan in the amount of 1000 USD.  He wants this loan to buy one milch cow for 600 USD and two calves for meat production.

loans.use: to buy one milch cow and two calves

loans.name: Saem

texts.en:
Saem C., 30, is a tailor who operates her business at the local market. In fact, she has a small store where she runs her business. Normally, Saem purchases cloths from suppliers to make clothes to sell, including traditional and modern clothes. She is married to Mr. Chheng An, 27, a motorcycle taxi driver around Kampong Thom Town. Saem has two children, each of whom lives at home and is in school.

To generate additional income, she is seeking a loan to purchase another sewing machine and to buy more cloths to sew and to later sell.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine and cloths to sew

loans.name: Vilma Hermelinda

texts.es:
Vilma pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y provincia de Yungay.

Vilma tiene 44 años de edad, aunque desde joven es madre soltera mantiene a sus 4 hijos de tal manera que apoyó a uno de sus hijos para realizarse profesionalmente, este hecho lo considera uno de sus mayores logros, así como también seguir con su negocio. No considera haber sido una dificultad el mantener a sus hijos, menciona que ha sido un reto y sigue siendo un reto todavía. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en un puesto provisional en el campo ferial de la ciudad de Yungay.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos para surtir su puesto.

Vilma afirma que le gustaría recibir charlas para saber llevar mejor su familia y mejorar su negocio
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso” in the district and province of Yungay in Ancash state in Peru. Vilma is 44 years old, and as a single mother she has supported her 4 children in a manner that enabled one of her children to become a professional and she considers this one of her greatest achievements, as well as being able to have a successful business. She doesn’t think it has been a difficulty to support her children, she mentions that is has been a goal and continues to be a goal today. Today she sells groceries in a provisional stall in the country market in Yungay city. With this loan for S/.2,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in purchasing supplies such as sugar, rice, and noodles to stock her stand. Vilma says that she would like to receive educational talks to know how to take care of her family better and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina L., a 46-year-old woman, is married with three children. Marina has been breeding calves in the small village of Imishli since 2000. Since living with her husband, she has bought and sold cattle. Marina works as an administrator of a local kindergarten, but her salary is not enough to cover the basic needs of her three children. Now Marina wants to expand her business, and as her children grow, she thinks that she will be able to sell more cattle with their help. She is requesting 1200 USD for the term of 15 months in order to purchase cattle. Marina expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Sokung

texts.en: Mrs. Sokung V. is a villager in Kaung Kang Ty Muoy village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Soam Huol, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. On this plantation they face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to hire laborers to work on the field. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Sokung V. decided to ask for a loan to hire them for this purpose. She is 30 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work on her and her husband's rice and vegetable field.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna P., 48, is a vegetable farmer and a vendor at the same time. She is accompanied by her husband named Gaudencio in her business activity by simply maintaining their rice and vegetable crops such as eggplant, pepper, and “ampalaya” (bitter gourd). Aside from that, the couple also maintains their hog-raising business to further improve their living conditions. Her two children stopped studying when they were young due to financial constraints.

Edna wants to receive a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to be able to purchase a complete fertilizer which is needed in their vegetable and rice business to generate higher income. Edna sells her vegetable produce wholesale to buyers who come to their village and retails also them when she has sufficient time to roam around their village. Edna and her husband consider each other and their family as inspiration for success.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Janet Alberta,

texts.es:
Janet siempre ha sentido afición por la fotografía, es por eso que cuando empezó a trabajar vendiendo ropa bajo pedido D. clientes ella se animó a ofrecer el servicio D. fotografía en el colegio D. su  hijo cada vez que había un evento especial.
Poco a poco el gusto por el arte fotográfico fue creciendo así que decidió dedicarse por completo a este oficio. Un tiempo después no solo ofrecía la toma D. fotos, sino también la filmación D. eventos. Ahora ya tiene dos años dedicándose a la filmación D. eventos y fiestas no solo escolares, también D. matrimonios, cumpleaños, etc.
Por otro lado, también venD. productos D. belleza desD. hace cinco años. Las ganancias que obtiene D. su trabajo las vuelve a reinvertir y una fracción la destina para las necesidades D. su menor hija. Su esposo se encarga del mantenimiento D. los además gastos D. la casa.
Más adelante ella desearía tener el capital suficiente para implementar un estudio fotográfico, ya sea en su casa o en otro lugar.
Productos D. belleza
texts.en:
Janet has always had an affinity for photography, which is why when she started selling custom order apparel, she decided to offer photography services at her son’s school whenever there was a special event. Little by little, her love of photography kept growing, so she decided to completely dedicate herself to this skill. After some time, she not only took pictures, but also started offering video services. She has now been videotaping special events—schools, weddings, birthdays, etc.—for two years. She has also been selling beauty products on the siD. for five years. She re-invests some of the profits, saving the other part of her income to pay for her young daughter’s necessities. Her husband covers the rest of the household expenses. She would like to have enough capital to set up her own picture studio—either in her own house or somewhere else—some time in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beauty products

loans.name: Sultonboy

texts.ru: Атамбою исполнилось 50 лет. он женат и имеет 5 детей. Работает в ресторане, который находится в центре города. Кроме основной работы в летнее время занимается сушкой абрикосов. Сейчас хозяин ресторана предложил ему заняться изготовлением шашлыка для кухни ресторана. Так как Султонбой ранее имел опыт в этой деятельности он согласился. Сейчас он собирается получить займ, чтобы приобрести мясо и уголь для своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Sultonboy is fifty years old, married and has 5 children. He works at a restaurant in the middle of the city. In addition to his job, Sultonboy dries apricots in the summer. Sultonboy's boss suggested him to make kebab for his restaurant. Sultonboy has made kebab in the past, so he agreed. Sultonboy will use this loan to purchase meat and coal for his business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meat and coal

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta M. manages a small rice farm. She is 55 years old and has 8 children who are still attending school. She is married to a farmer named Maximo M.. Her life is in the farm and she believes that they have a bright future in growing rice. Like other wives, Benedicta helps her husband on the farm. She also started running a new sari-sari store business to supplement their income.

She now wants a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use a loan to buy fertilizers and herbicides. The loan will help her family achieve a bigger yield. The loan will also help her get started in the new business.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people, especially the poor, to start and have their own business. They provide not only credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta S., 30 and married with six children, has many years of experience in the popcorn business. She sells to the general public three days per week and has a weekly net cash flow of about 150 Tala ($62).  She has no previous loans with SPBD which is her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase corn and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
S. Nguyen Thi (727020912) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of Vinh Phuc. She is married and has two infant children. To make a living, S. owns and operates a business selling herbs and spices in the local community. S. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

S. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa Y. is 39 years old. She is married and a mother of five kids. Yaa lives with her husband and children at Dorma town. Yaa is a food vendor who prepares and sells kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains that are cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. Yaa has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. In addition, she also sells raw food like bags of maize at the market square of Dorma. She has been selling kenkey for five years now.

Yaa wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to earn more income to support her children, especially in their education. She belongs to the village called ‘Gyedie mu Aba’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.pt:
Matilde de 35 anos nasceu na cidade de Maputo, estudou até quarta classe sendo o motivo de baixa escolarização a morte dos pais quando ela ainda era criança é mãe solteira e tem 4 filhos de 16,10,8 e 5 anos, respectivamente. Vive na casa própria.

É comerciante a mais de 5 anos e dona do seu próprio negocio, tendo aprendido a actividade por imperativos da vida. Vende produtos frescos no mercado local e suas vendas diárias oscilam entre 500.00MT a 700.00MT.

Este é o quarto empréstimo, e nunca trabalhou com outras instituições de microfinanças, sendo única parceira a Hluvuku. Com o valor emprestado pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria e diversificar os produtos de venda.

Futuramente pretende ter água canalizada e construir muro de vedação da sua residência e conta ter mais empréstimos com a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Matilde, 35 years old, was born in the city of Maputo. She studied at school until fourth grade. The reason she had so little education was the death of her parents when she was still a child. She is a single mother and has four children, 16, 10, 8 and 5 years old, respectively. She lives in her own house. Matilde has been a merchant for more than five years and owns her own business. Learning this trade was a matter of survival. She sells fresh produce in the local market and her daily sales vary between 500 MT and 700 MT. This is her fourth loan. She has never worked with other microfinancing institutions, but has only worked with Hluvuku. With this loan she plans to increase the volume of her merchandise and diversify the products she sells. In the future, she plans to have indoor plumbing and to build a weather-proof wall for her home. She counts on having more loans from Hluvuku.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel P. tiene 46 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Laredo , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta sexto D. primaria , tiene 3hijos, pero 2 dependen económicamente D. ella.
Maria Isabel se dedica a la realización a la venta D. productos D. belleza D. Esika, Avon, Unique. Los cuales los distribuye en distintos puestos del  mercado D.  Laredo, pero también venD. a sus amistades, vecinos y familiares.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles compro mas productos para que pueda vender con mas frecuencia.
Con el crédito D. 2,000 soles lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra D. mas productos D. belleza D. esika , avon, unique como: colonias , talcos, cremas, perfumes, labiales, etc
Maria Isabel   tiene como sueño alquilar un stand en un centro comercial D. Trujillo  y vender sus productos
texts.en:
Maria Isabel P. is 46 years old, and lives in the Laredo district, Trujillo province, in La Libertad, Perú. This entrepreneur studied until the 6th year of secondary school, and has 3 children but only 2 still depend on her financially. Maria Isabel dedicates herself to selling beauty products from the Esika, Avon and Unique lines. She distributes these throughout the various markets in Laredo, and also sells to her friends, neighbors, and relatives. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought more products so she could sell more frequently. With the loan of 2,000 soles, she will invest in her business and buy more Esika, Avon and Unique products such as: colognes, powders, creams, perfumes, lipsticks, etc. Maria Isabel’s dream is to rent a stand in a commercial area in Trujillo and sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business, buying beauty products from the Esika, Avon and Unique lines such as:  colognes, powders, creams, perfumes, lipsticks, etc.

loans.name: Fear Not Group

texts.en:
Ernestina is 29. She is divorced and has two children; one is in school and the other is still breastfeeding. As a single mother, responsibility for her family rests on her shoulders. For that reason she is serious about her business. She prepares pastries such as meat pies and sells them on the streets. She started selling four years ago and has seen a dramatic improvement in her business. She requests a loan to buy flour, sugar, margarine etc., to produce pastries in larger quantities

Based on her commitment and hard work she was made the group leader of a trust bank group called ‘Fear Not’. She is the one squatting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and for peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy margarine, flour, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, es comerciante vende mercadería, viaja a el interior del país para  la compra de electrodomésticos y vajillas.
Vive en la zona de Villa Armonia de la ciudad de La Paz. En casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para el capital de trabajo ( vajillas ropa, y electrodomésticos.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Las ganas de trabajar le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Roberto is a storekeeper. He travels to the interior of the country to buy electrical appliances and dishes. He lives in his own house in the Villa Armonia area of the city of La Paz. This loan will be used for business (dishes, clothes, and electrical appliances). This is the first time he has applied for a loan from Impro. His desire to work has given him the opportunity to have access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Ruby May

texts.en:
According to Ruby May “hard work and patience is the key to success”. She bears those qualities, thus Ruby May is hoping someday to become successful in her mushroom production business. She is already 35 years old and is happily married to Fernando. They have two children who are both attending the primary level of education.

Mushroom production is quite difficult sometimes, because some of their bought mushrooms seeds (semelia) were unproductive and also because of hot temperature that cause the mushrooms not to grow. Ruby May is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 in order to keep her business going and overcome those factors affecting her business so she can progress.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El señor Victor M. tiene ya más de dieciocho años dedicándose a su taller de soldadura esté negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
Al negocio le está haciendo material de acero y una cortadora de metal, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión.
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así poder comprar el material y la cortadora de metal ya que tiene que elaborar varios pedidos de figuras navideñas que tiene que entregar en el próximo mes a sus clientes. 
Don Victor ya a tenidos cinco créditos con FVP y un con Kiva que fue a nombre de sus esposa la señora San Juanita Maricela Hernández, los cuales han pagado puntual mente.
Están muy agradecidos por la gran ayuda que les brindaron en el anterior crédito el cual pudieron comprar la maquina para realizar las figuras.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor M. has worked at his welding workshop for more than eighteen years. This business is his family's income source.

The business needs steel and a metal cutter, but at the moment he does not have the necessary money for the investment.

Therefore he is requesting a loan in order to buy the material and the cutter as he needs to meet several orders for christmas figures to be delivered to his customers next month. Don Victor has had five loans with FVP and one with Kiva in the name of his wife, Mrs. San Juanita Maricela Hernández, all repaid punctually.

They are very grateful for the great support offered with the previous loan which allowed him to be able to purchase the machine to make the figures.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase steel and a metal cutter.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
This is Leonora Z., who is 47 years old. She lives in Silang, Cavite. Her husband, Felimon, 49, is a truck driver.  They have three adult children; one stays at home, another one is in college and the youngest is still in high school.

Leonora provides a home service doing manicures, pedicures and foot spas. She takes pride in her line of work because she was able to send her eldest child to college. Half of her life has been devoted to doing her work. She is also into buying and selling window curtains.  She earns 11,000 Philippine pesos of net income per month.  

She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. She is now on her sixth loan cycle and has just recently applied for a loan in the amount of P19,000. She will use the funds to buy a new manicure set, nail colors (polish), foot-spa medicated solution and other supplies for her business.

Leonora wishes to have her own house and lot where she and her children can live happily. She is also working hard to pursue her other childrens' education.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social-development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy a manicure set and other beauty-care products

loans.name: Yawovi

texts.fr: Yawovi  S. est un homme de 45 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants.  Il habite à Kpadape, un village situé à 10 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est un transformateur du vin de palm en sodabi. Il achète des palmiers, les abats et quelque jour après, il vient recueilli du vin de palm avec lequel il fabrique le sodabi. Avec ce crédit, il voudrait acheter des palmiers pour sa transformation en sodabi. Il compte épargner de l’argent avec les bénéfices qu’il obtiendra. Dans l’avenir, il aimerait avoir une usine de fabrication de vin communément appelé au Togo « SODABI ».

loans.use: production de la boisson locale ( sodabi )

loans.name: Muani

texts.en:
Muani is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Ejura in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Muani works to support her husband financially to provide for the family.

Muani is a trader and sells provisions on a table by the roadside in her community. She procures the goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Nimia Idelsa

texts.es:
La señora  NIMIA IDELSA L. M., tiene  39 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SANTA ELENA II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria y  tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella porque se encuentra estudiando. La socia se dedica  a la crianza y venta de pollos. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró pollos bebes y alimento para criarlos, los mismo que vendió posteriormente.
Con este crédito de 300 soles, comprará gallinas ponedoras para vender pollos y huevos.
Ella sueña con tener su propia granja de pollos para así poder generar mayores ingresos y continuar apoyando en los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Nimia Idelsa L. M. is 39 years old and lives in the District of La Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Santa Elena II Communal Bank. Nimia has 3 dependent children. She completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school.

Nimia raises and sells chickens. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought baby chicks and feed for maintaining them. Those birds were eventually sold. She is requesting another loan of 300 soles to buy hens to sell for meat and eggs. Her dream is to have her own poultry farm so that she can generate more revenue to continue supporting her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase egg-laying hens

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 25 years old and is single. She takes care of her brother and a 3-year-old orphan of a deceased relative. She lives in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Jeanne is a hardworking businesswoman, owning and operating a popular local restaurant in which she employs ten people. This is her 4th successful year in business. The hours of her business require that she works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Jeanne struggles to make a profit each month and believes that she does not carry enough variety of drinks and food. Also, she needs supplies. To this end, a small amount of additional capital would help her business to grow in a meaningful way.

For that reason, Jeanne is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase these additional items and supplies so that she may serve her existing customers better and attract new customers. This she expects will mean an increase in her sales.

If her strategy is successful, Jeanne will be able to build a stronger business and put aside some savings for a more secure future for herself and her young family.

loans.use: To purchase food, beverages and supplies

loans.name: Oscar Enrique

texts.en: Oscar has a small store, called a pulpería, that he operates out of the front of his house. Oscar has three children.  About five years ago when his wife was pregnant with their second child she was too ill to continue her work as a housekeeper, so they decided to open a small store that she could run while maintaining her health and safety. Oscar dreams of being able to improve his house and of helping his children get ahead. Oscar and his family have greatly benefited from the loans that he has received: Oscar says that he would not have been able to manage the repayments without the support of his wife.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nia

texts.en:
Nia T. is 54 and married with 6 children (ages 17 - 38).  She owns a business venture, selling pork products in the local community.  Nia has 3 years of experience in this business.  Nia needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Nia joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Nia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Nia T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.8 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase pork products, flavoring, sugar and plastic bags

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: S., 38 years old, is a good mother blessed with four children. Her four grown children go to school or to work at different occupations. Her husband is a civil service officer who works in a national prison. S. earns a living as a domestic rice cultivator. Presently she owns a machine to provide her service. She is always hired by people to plow their farmland. Recently S. faced a problem with her farming; she lacks some supplies to perform her business. Thus she looks for a loan to purchase a machine and pump to irrigate her crop. She will buy more fertilizers if any money is left from the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a machine and pump.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more hair creams and other hair products to sell

loans.name: Sergio Oldemar

texts.es:
El Sr. Sergio Oldemar G. B. es cliente de CEPRODEL desde Marzo del 2008 donde ha trabajado 3 créditos con nuestra institución. Los que ha utilizado para invertir en la mejora de su casa. 

En todos estos  dos años ha demostrado ser un buen cliente. Con un buen record crediticio. El trabaja en la Empresa Lidya Ludic Nicaragua S.A ocupando el cargo de Técnico Supervisor de Máquinas Tragamonedas.

El tiene 40 años de edad, casado y con 3 personas a su cargo, sus dos hijos y su esposa el habita en la zona de Sábana Grande, en la parte occidental de la capital. 

El está agradecido con CEPRODEL y espera seguir trabajando con nuestra institución, ya que le gusta el trato humano que se le brinda.
texts.en:
Sergio has been a client of CEPRODEL since March of 2008 and has had three loans through our institution, which he used to make improvements to his home. In all these years he has proven himself to be a good client with a good credit record. He works as a technical supervisor of slot machines for the Lidya Ludic Nicaragua S.A company. He is 40 years old, married, and has two children. He lives on the west side of the capital, in the Sábana Grande zone. He is very grateful for CEPRODEL and would like to continue to work with our institution because he likes the personal treatment that he receives.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Nike

texts.en:
Thirty-four years old, Nike is married and has a child aged 10 years. Nike sells snacks and drinks in a private secondary school in Lagos State to earn a living. She has been in this business for the past six years. She leaves home early to purchase snacks for the day’s business. She said the school children patronize her because her drinks are always cold and her snacks are nice. She hopes for business expansion.

Nike wants the loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more drinks and snacks to sell as this will help increase her income. She promises to pay back the loan when due. She thanks Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Komil

texts.en:
G. Komil is a successful father and dedicated husband. He has three children.

Komil began a small grocery store five years ago with a small capital of savings. He was assisted by his wife who helps him with serving his clients. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery become more popular.

He is asking for a loan of 3000 USD so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Komil is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve successes in his business with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and increase the range of goods to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia G. is from the village of Maanas, Gingoog City. She is 46 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Letecia owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling specialty food products like rice cakes and rice pops which she usually peddles during morning and afternoon snacks time in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Letecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rakan

texts.en:
Rakan is a 33-year-old married man and father of two children. He lives with this family in Chtoura, in the Bekaa. Since 1995, Rakan has worked as a small-business entrepreneur, selling seasonal fruits and vegetables that he buys from local farmers.
Today, Rakan is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise in order to fill his shop. In this way, he hopes to increase his sales and therefore his income. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. Rakan is known for the good quality of his produce and hopes to continue to satisfy his customers' demands in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
Hà Trương Thị (20203050013) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Y. Phong - B. Ninh.  Hà is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách nhóm 03 (3).


Hà is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Hà owns and operates a furniture-making business, making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members.  Hà has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately $267 a month from these activities.


In 2009, Hà joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.000.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7.840.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.  This will be her 2nd loan from SEDA.  Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050011) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Y. (20203050015) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20203050024) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.


4.  Nguyễn V. H. (20203050012) is a 29-year-old male who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support his business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.


5.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050096) is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


6.  Trương Thị B. (20203050097) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hà  Trương Thị (20203050013) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Y. Phong - B. Ninh.  Hà  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các tH.nh viên.  Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách nhóm 03 (3).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán T. thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hà  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hà  kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hà  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hà  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.000.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguY. liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050011) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Y. (20203050015) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20203050024) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất.


4.  Nguyễn V. H. (20203050012) là 29 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh chế tạo H.ng nội thất.


5.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050096) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


6.  Trương Thị B. (20203050097) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía B. Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic D. is from the village of Hinaplanan, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Marivic is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Marivic joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Marivic from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Phen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phen S., 45, is a married woman and raises a few pigs to earn a living. Phen S. lives with her 44-year-old husband who has been distilling white wine, and they are able to earn the formal revenue to support any daily expenses of their family. The couple is blessed with six children, of whom two are now married and the others are single. 

Phen S. has applied for a loan to add to her savings in order to purchase a used motorbike, so she can use it to travel without hiring a taxi. Mrs. Phen S. is the group leader for a two-member group who will jointly repay the Kiva loan. Mrs. C., 31, is a farmer. C. is requesting a loan to repair an old motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice B. is a seamstress and also sells zips, thread and other sewing materials at Abura. Beatrice has no educational background.  She is married to a driver and they have three children. 

Beatrice has been sewing for some time now. She helps her husband in paying the school fees of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more sewing materials for making clothes for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a shop in the marketplace where she can sew her clothing.

loans.use: buy more sewing materials to make clothes for sale

loans.name: Adila

texts.ru:
Adile 36 qoda .Ona jivet v qorode Baku. Na risunke vi mojete videt brata Adili (Rovshan) s kotorim ona jivet vmeste. Ona bila zamujem no posle razriva teper jivet s bratom i rabotayet vmeste snim v odnom biznese.Adila uje zanimayetsya etim biznesem 6 let a yeyo brat 7 let. Ona ne imeyet detey. 

Seychas Adila nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit produkti dlya pereprodaji . V sobstvennosti ona xotelabi kupit moyushiye sredstva dlya tarelok dlya odejdi dlya uborki doma.
texts.en:
Adila is 36 years old. She lives in the city of Baku. On the picture you can see Adila’s brother Rovshan, who lives together with her. Adila was married in the past but after the separation from her husband she has been living with her brother and working in the same business with him. She has been in business for six years already, and her brother for seven years. She doesn’t have children. At present Adila needs 2000 Azerbaijani Manats in order to buy goods for resale. More specifically, she would like to buy different types of detergents: for dishwashing, for doing the laundry and for household cleaning.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying goods for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower is 30 years old, married and has four children. She graduated from a literacy program. 

The borrower is a tailor. She will use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine, an embroidery machine, and cloth. The borrower has a much experience in sewing and a fine reputation in the area. Many clients go to her. 

The borrower has an enormous ambition to develop her business in the future to attract more clients.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, an embroidery machine, and cloth

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina L. is from the town of Rizal West, San Isidro. She is 53 years old. Divina is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Divina owns & operates a business selling fruits and vegetables. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables to the local community. Divina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Divina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Divina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials needed to grow produce for sale. Divina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to grow produce for sale. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Divina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Rajabboy

texts.en:
Y. Rajabboy was born in 1948 in B.Gafurov region, where he now works as a farmer. He is married and has 3 children. His main business is agriculture, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family. Rajabboy owns a large piece of land where he cultivates different kinds of vegetables, but due to the poor quality of the soil and the insects, he is no longer able to satisfy market demand. Very hard-working, he is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy seeds, fertilizer and also calves. The loan will greatly improve Rajabboy’s income and his family's living standards. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, mineral fertilizer and calves

loans.name: Soriano

texts.en:
Soriano P. is from the village of Tipolo. He is 55 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, he operates a manufacturing business, selling specially manufactured products to local businesses and community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Soriano joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Soriano is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his 4th loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Ana Carolina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Ana Carolina; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de una academia norteña donde enseña el baile de la marinera que es un baile típico del norte de Peru, ella es la administradora y tiene profesores que enseña este baile a diferentes personas ya sean niños, jóvenes y adultos, ella atiende desde las 4:00 p.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia quiere implementar la academia.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar espejos, televisor y Dvd y de esta manera implementar la academia.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “KUKULI” communal bank; the bank is located in Cusco district, Cusco province, and Cusco state.

The member is Mrs. Ana Carolina; she is 49 years old, married, and has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with business at a dance school where she teaches dances typical of northern Peru. She is the director and has teachers who teach this dance to different people including children, youth, and adults. She works at the school from 4:00 PM to 8:00 PM; she wishes to open an academy. The member seeks a loan to buy mirrors, a TV, and DVD and in this way open an academy.

The member is grateful to those who are helping her reach this dream and she promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: Buy mirrors, TV, and DVD to open her academy

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas S. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 34 years old, married and has three children. To make a living, Tomas plants and harvests rice for sale. Tomas works hard to provide income for his family and have savings in case of emergencies. 

Tomas joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Tomas has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Tomas is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man and the father of 4 children. One of his children is attending the university. He works as a farmer specialized in cultivating lemon products. He has been involved in this occupation since 1990. He works hard to be able to provide a good education for his children. And today, he is requesting a loan $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for his son courses at the university. His son is studying business management and he is in his second year. In the future, his son is planning to work in an advertising and marketing company.

loans.use: to pay for his son courses at the university

loans.name: Roberto Favian

texts.es: Para Roberto V. vender mercancía desde muy temprano siempre ha sido el pan de cada día, porque con este negocio ha logrado sostener su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos de 4 y 6 años, con quienes sueña verlos convertidos en unos profesionales exitosos, por eso no descansará trabajando hasta lograrlo. El inició vendiendo sillas, artículos de cocina y adornos, entre sus vecinos mas cercanos, y gradualmente se fue enfocando hacia el ramo de la juguetería,  electrodomésticos y está posicionado no solo en su barrio, sino en los alrededores de él, porque ya es muy conocido y lo buscan para hacerle pedidos, por eso  Roberto está aplicando a su credikiva, pues tiene encargado los juguetes de navidad de los hijos de sus clientes y electrodomésticos y también porque  está afanado por tener lo que sus clientes le encarguen; pues en estas fiestas de fin de año,  aunque en su recuperación de  cartera  la rotación aumenta, debe esperar hasta que le paguen las primas y bonificaciones a sus clientes para volver a comprar, de tal manera que este financiamiento lo oxigenaría mucho su negocios y facilitaría el  dar respuesta a sus compradores. Este es el segundo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el primero logró incrementar su inventario, sus ventas y por consiguiente obtuvo mayor utilidad. Su gran desfio es tener un local propio en un corredor comercial, que impulse  las ventas por sus condiciones específicas, para que sus esfuerzos se vean reflejados mas rapidamente y se vaya cumpliendo poco a poco sus metas de llevar a sus hijos a la universidad y brindarles un mejor estar a su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto V. has earned money selling merchandise for a long time, and this business supports his family, which consists of his wife, and two children who are 4 and 6 years old.  He dreams of his children being successful professionals, so he never stops working hard to achieve that dream.

He started out selling chairs, kitchen implements, and decorations to his neighbors and gradually became focused on selling toys and household appliances.  He now sells both in his neighborhood and the surrounding area because he is well known and people look for him to place orders.  

Roberto is applying for this loan because he has orders to fill for Christmas toys for the children of his customers and for home appliances and he is in a hurry to have those items.
