Although in the recovery of his portfolio the rotation increases, he has to wait until he pays the premiums and discounts to his customers to return to shop, so this loan will stimulate his business and help him respond to his buyers.

This is the second loan he has received from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  With his first loan, he was able to increase his inventory and his sales, which earned him more income.  His biggest challenge is having a location for his business along the commercial corridor, which will boost sales because of its good location.  His efforts will get results more quickly so he can achieve his goal of sending his children to college and provide for his family.

loans.use: Purchase Christmas toys and household appliances ordered by his customers

loans.name: Batuli

texts.en:
Batuli A. M., age 43 and unmarried, supports her nuclear family. She runs a cafe business in Bombolulu and has operated this business for the last two years with good profits.

This will be her first loan with KADET Ltd and she plans to expand her business by purchasing more foodstuffs such as tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages, rice, and maize flour, as well as more chairs for the hotel. She hopes to use the anticipated profits to start another business that she has been considering starting for some time.

Her dream is to live happily and to see her business flourish.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and chairs for her cafe business

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 42 años de edad, es una madre de familia amable y estricta en sus labores, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Rocío, está felizmente casada con un albañil, maestro de obras, con quien tiene un pacto de negocio. Ya que les provee comida a sus trabajadores, vendiendo diario de 25 a 30 porciones, negocio que le ha dado proporcionado muchas rentas. Es así que madruga muy temprano por la mañana, para preparar los alimentos, siendo almacenados en táper, puesto que serán trasladados al centro de trabajo de los albañiles. Han transcurrido 3 años realizando esta labor, que desea construir su casa de material noble hasta el segundo nivel, para acondicionar habitaciones para sus hijos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene pagar sin retrasos, y se compromete a cumplirlo, ya que anhela acceder a posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar accesorios de cocina y renovar táper de plásticos para su negocio y así continuar trabajando con la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Rocío, 42, is a kind mother who is very strict with her work.  She lives in her own house with her husband and three children.  She is happily married to a bricklayer, a master construction worker, that she has a business partnership with.  She provides meals for his workers; she sells 25 to 30 portions daily.  This is a business that has been very profitable.

She rises very early in the morning to prepare the meals that are then stored in Tupperware because they will be transported to the bricklayers’ work site.

She has been in this business for three years.  She wants to build her house out of substantial materials up to a second story to furnish bedrooms for her children.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She knows that she has to pay on time and commits to do so because she wants to be able to access future loans.

She will use the requested loan to buy kitchen accessories and new Tupperware for her business so that she can continue with her business selling food.

loans.use: To buy kitchen accessories and new Tupperware.

loans.name: Vilma Del Socorro

texts.es: Vilma del Socorro tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 pues siempre por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita créditos.  Ella  se dedica a la elaboración de ropa variada, bolsos y mochilas. Su forma de comercializar sus productos es de manera ambulante ya que es la única manera de obtener una gran variedad de clientes. Actualmente solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como hilos, tijeras, tela, zipper entre otras cosas. Pues en esta temporada tiene bastantes encargos y quiere mantener  su clientela.
texts.en: Vilma del Socorro has been working with Fundación León 2000 for quite some time, so this is not the first time she is requesting a loan.  She makes a variety of clothing, bags, and backpacks.  She sells her products on foot, as this is the only way to obtain a good variety of customers.  Right now she is requesting a loan to buy thread, scissors, fabric, zippers, and other materials, because she receives a lot of orders at this time of year and wants to maintain her clientele.

loans.use: to buy thread, scissors, fabric, zippers, and other sewing materials

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong S. is a 28-year-old fisherwoman and the mother of four school-aged children. Every day in the early morning, Hong S. and her husband always go to fish in and around their village and then they hurry up and bring their fish by motorbike to the market to sell. In addition, Hong S.’s husband also uses his existing motorbike to pick up passengers for fees. Unfortunately, an existing motorbike is broken down. To help her husband, Hong S. would like to request a loan for her husband to purchase a used motorcycle for replacing the broken one. She proposes to use the remainder of the loan to buy equipment for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle to replace a broken one, and to buy equipment for fishing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy  wheels, shock absorbers, springs, jacks, a battery and alternator for their vehicle.

loans.name: Du's Group

texts.en:
Du T. L. is 51 years old and has two children. One of them is attending a training course on driving. 

Du T. L. is a farmer. She grows rice, corn and vegetables and raises pigs for meat. This business has been run for a long time. It helps her to have food for her family and the sale of the products help them have cash to pay for their daily needs. 

Being a client of our credit program since 2006, she has been a good group leader. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy  food for pigs.

Huyen T. N. is 29 years old. She has a hair salon shop at home. She needs to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy more hair care products.

loans.use: To buy  food for pigs

loans.name: Allison Joseph

texts.es: Alisson Josehp tiene 32 años, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella decidió iniciar este negocio con le propósitos de mantener a sus 3 hijos que son lo más importante y el motivo de su lucha, pero se vio muy afectada ya que por las mañanas tiene que alistar su bolso para ofrecer los diferentes productos que le solicitan, la mayoría de sus clientes son jóvenes. Ella solicita este medio de vida para la compra de cosméticos, calzado, ropa en general entre otras cosas. Ella desea proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Alisson Josehp is 32 and has made a living selling general merchandise for more than 8 years.  She decided to start this business in order to support her three children who are most important and what motivate her to keep going.  She found it difficult because she has to get the bags ready in the mornings to be able to offer the variety of products that are sought after.  Most of her customers are young people.  She is taking out this loan to purchase make up, shoes, general clothing and other things.  She would also like to make some improvements to her home.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion G. is from the village of North Poblacion, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Concepcion is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, beverages and eggs in the local community. She is also buying and selling coconuts for copras (dried coconut meat used for oil production). She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Concepcion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and snack foods. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem P., 34, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantation. 

P. and her husband sell traditional baskets and palm sugar, earning an income of about US $4 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $74 on food and US $56 on the other necessary expenses. 

P. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to transport the baskets to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport baskets to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to add to her stock

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia is currently in a business of selling green vegetables. She is 40 years old, married, with five children, all of whom go to school. Cicilia borrowed a loan to stock more green vegetables to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Basilides

texts.es:
Basilides tiene 68 años de edad es un señor casado que vive  en la zona rural de  la campiña San Nicolás -Lambayeque. Zona cuya actividad principal es la agricultura y ganadería.

Basilides a pesar de sus años, tiene que ver la manera de mantener su hogar y es por eso que desde hace un año vende verduras en el mercado de Lambayeque, donde es conocido por la buena calidad de sus productos y por ello goza de una clientela ya establecida. Basilides adicionalmente cría y comercializa aves de corral (pato, pavo) y  también realiza actividades agrícolas, como la cosecha de limones.

Basilides solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles, cuyo destino será la compra de mercadería (verduras) y otros gastos personales que necesita realizar.
texts.en:
Basilides is 68 years old.  He is a married man that lives in the rural area of San Nicolás - Lambayeque where the primary business is agriculture and raising livestock.  

In spite of his age, Basilides has to provide for his household.  Because of this he has been selling vegetables in the Lambayeque market for a year.  He enjoys a well established customer base because he is known for his high quality products.  He also raises and sells poultry (ducks, turkeys) and works in agriculture, such as harvesting lemons.  

Basilides is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency].  He will use it to purchase merchandise (vegetables) and to cover other personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell and personal expenses.

loans.name: Las Camelias Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Camelias, inicia su ciclo número 3 con 11 socios, las cuales tienen diferentes negocios como alquiler D. gras sintético, venta D. chicha, venta D. abarrotes, animales menores, venta D. ropa.
Julia, es la Presidenta para este ciclo en el Banco Comunal, tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Se dedica la venta D. ropa por pedidos. Ingresó a FINCA Perú por la invitación D. un amiga, le gusta por la facilidad en los créditos, las capacitaciones que recibe por parte D. su promotora y sobre todo porque pueD. ahorrar. Sus ahorros lo invirtió en surtir sus mercaderías.
texts.en:
Las Camelias Communal Bank started its third cycle with 11 members who have different businesses such as the rental of synthetic grass, chicha (a Latin American drink, typically alcoholic, maD. of fermented maize) sales, small animals, and clothing sales. 
Julia is the President for this cycle of the Communal Bank.  She is 36 years old, married and has 2 children.  She sells clothing to order. She joined FINCA Peru through the invitation of a friend.  She likes it because of the ease of loans, the trainings she receives from the loan officer and above all because she can save. She invests her savings in stocking her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes for the season.

loans.name: Rida

texts.en:
Rida sells finished silk fabric. She buys it from the weavers in her village and transports it to sell at different places far away from her home. Her husband, Phally, has full-time employment in Phnom Penh City. They live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have 3 young children, two sons and one daughter. 

Rida is asking for a loan of $1000 to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To renovate the house where she lives.

loans.name: Maeda

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 30 years old, married, and has five children.

Maeda is a tailor; she has been making and repairing women’s clothing since 2006. She gained her experience from her mother and she has a good reputation and she is well known in her area.
  
She is requesting a $1200 loan to buy a split air conditioner and a sewing machine. She is aiming to increase her income so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a split air conditioner and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is one of those few people who was able to turn her beloved pastime into a way to make a living. “I get so excited about making bags. I never thought I could do it as a real job!” Jennifer, of Jendarling Bags, began designing and producing bags in 2008 in the scarce free time her 9-5 job afforded her. Over the past three years, her hobby has quickly turned into an all-consuming endeavor: she debuted her first collection at the London Fashion Week, at an Ethical Fashion event, at The Hospital Club, and she has been featured by local news sources such as DailyCandy, Treehugger and San Francisco’s beloved local magazine, 7X7.  

Jen’s one-of-a-kind bags are a reflection of her diverse background and interests. With degrees ranging from nonprofit management and business to working at an environmental agency, she drew from each of these experiences when developing her company. 

As a businesswoman and an environmentalist, Jen prides herself on her business’ commitment to sustainability: various collections incorporate sustainable efforts such as using local, fair trade and organic materials. Many of the zippers are nickel-free, and she relies on mostly reclaimed materials for the bags. All of the leather comes from nearby Napa and is manufactured right here in the Bay Area, supporting local jobs and reducing the carbon footprint inherent in outsourcing. 

Jen recently landed a partnership to sell her bags in a high-end retail store. “I was thrilled to land this account because it will open my business to a whole new array of clients!” said Jen. However, when the retailer placed two orders for June and July, Jen realized she did not have the capital she would need to purchase nine different colors of leather to fill this large order.

Jen knew that her bank would not be interested in giving her the small loan amount she needed, nor would it be able to provide her a quick turnaround. Having learned about Opportunity Fund at San Francisco’s Small Business Week, she turned to the local microlender and was approved for a loan within days. This loan of $3,000 will help her to secure the large order with her new partner, affording her the opportunity to grow her business.

Jen takes pride in her fabrics, her mission and her commitment to sustainability. She dreams one day of opening up her own boutique devoted to the same values.

loans.use: to pay for more materials to make her handbags.

loans.name: Rose Jean

texts.en:
This is Rosejean, 34, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Zacarias, a driver, and mother to her child. By the grace of God, Rosejean has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to send her daughter to school to finish her degree.

Rosejean oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have a jeepney that has a capacity of 18 persons, which is paying a boundary (daily quota) of 1,000 each day. Rosejean’s husband drives the jeepney. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use he loan to buy new tires for the jeepneys, and renew her registration. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosejean dreams that her child will finish her education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new parts, accessories and registration of her vehicle

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married with one son aged four years old. He operates a tailoring shop at a local market in Kitengela. He has been in this business for seven years now and hires two employees. He describes himself as customer friendly.

Peter says while the business is profitable, the only major challenge he faces is financial constraints. Peter plans to use this loan to purchase more sewing materials so as to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. In the future, he hopes to open a branch at Mlolongo shopping center.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 46-year-old married man with six children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after the family and his dream is to have a sustainable income-generating activity to support his family. Robert is a fish vendor and has been in this business for 10 years now. His major challenge is the high license fees and his dream is to buy a refrigerating van. Robert needs the loan to buy fish for resale.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is 43 years old, married and a father of three children. Lucas is a poultry farmer in Kilifi. His business has been in operation for the last two years and it has been a success. 

This marks his second borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. With this loan, Lucas plans to expand his business by purchasing more chicks and chicken feed. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 22 años, es un hombre muy honesto y trabajador, es padre de una niña de un año de edad, vive junto a su pareja en casa de sus suegros en donde intenta brindar lo mejor a su pequeña hija. El trabajo de Jorge consiste en el transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, además de tener una bodega muy surtida en su casa del cual se hace cargo su pareja. Lleva poco tiempo en este negocio de la venta de abarrotes, pero como Mototaxista lleva ya varios años con lo que puede mantener a su familia. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede tener doble ingreso, ya que las ganancias que le genera la bodega lo deriva para los alimentos y los que obtiene de las ganancias del servicio de transporte son ahorrados para cualquier emergencia. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado lo usará para pagar la inicial de un nuevo mototaxi que tiene en mente comprar.
texts.en: Jorge is 22 years old. He is a very honest and hardworking man and the father of a 1 year old girl. He lives with his partner in his partner's parents house where he intends to provide the best for his daughter. Jorge transports passengers in his motorcycle taxi. In addition, he has a well-stocked grocery store at home which his partner takes care of. He has been only a short time in the grocery business, however as a motorcycle taxi driver he has several years experience and can take care of his family with what he earns. What he likes about his work is that he can have two incomes. He uses the profits from the grocery store for food and the profits from the transport business he saves for emergencies. This is his 2nd loan with MFP and hopes you will all support him. The amount sought will be used for the down payment on a new motorcycle taxi which he considering buying.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn is 51 years old and lives in Olo, Siquijor. She is widowed with five children.

Remelyn displays fresh fish for a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase fresh fish to sell every day.

Remelyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 11 months. In the future, Remelyn hopes to uplift her living standard from being poor.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish to sell every day.

loans.name: Bannawag

texts.en:
Bannawag started his hog raising business two years ago with three piglets for fattening. Bannawag is 48 years of age and is married. They are blessed with two children who they are sending to school. With his duration in business, Bannawag learned that his business is more profitable if he has a pig for breeding.

Bannawag is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs. He believes that the loan will be a big help for him to maintain his business. He hopes to continue sending his children to school until college through the profits he earns from the business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs.

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Than, 25 years old, is a farmer and pig feeder who earns $4 per day. Her husband sells palm products and earns $10 per day. They have one child who is not yet ready to go to school. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a hand tractor for doing farming.  The hand tractor can help her to do farming and transport sugar to sell in the market and to her customers. She has plans to buy a stock of sugar to sell when the price is good.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor for doing farming

loans.name: Bitia Yorleny

texts.es:
Yorleny tiene 33 años de edad y vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, la cual pertenece a la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.

Desde unos anos que Yorleny desea hacer unos cambios en su casa, es por eso que para ella es una gran oportunidad el formar parte de esta Empresa de crédito. 

Actualmente Yorleny está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢200.000 (doscientos mil colones) para  poder comprar materiales de construcción específicamente tablilla, para asi arreglar el techo de su hogar. Con esto el espera darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, ya que su deseo estar más tranquila, que sus hijos vivan más cómodos y tengan un techo digno.

Yorleny es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Francisco, una de las 150 organizaciones socios de EDESA en Costa Rica. Continuara creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Yorleny is 33 years old and lives with her spouse and children in a community called San Carlos, in Costa Rica's second largest province, Alajuela. This is a zone which stands in first place nationally for coffee and sugar cane production. It also produces staple foods (rice, beans, corn), fruits, vegetables, root crops and leafy greens. Juan Santamaría International Airport, the most important in the country, is also located in this province.

For the past few years, Yorleny has been wanting to make some changes to her house, and for this reason, joining this credit group was a great opportunity for her. 

Currently, Yorleny is requesting a microloan of ¢200,000 (two hundred thousand colones) so that she can buy construction materials, specifically pieces of sheeting, so that she can fix up the roof of her house. With this, she hopes to give her family a better quality of life. Her desires are to have more peace of mind, to help her children live more comfortably, and to give them a proper roof. 

Yorleny is a member of the San Francisco communal bank, one of EDESA's 150 partner organizations in Costa Rica. She plans to continue growing on a personal and economic level, and to participate actively in her community's credit organization.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Ruth Mercedes

texts.es: Ruth Mercedes se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, desde hace más de 11 años que tiene este medio de vida. Empezó este negocio con muy pocos productos pero con el paso del tiempo es que ha incrementado su inventario y también sus clientes a quienes siempre les brinda el medio de vida. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes y vestidos. Sueña con  mejorar sus ingresos y seguir adelante con este medio de vida.
texts.en:
Ruth Mercedes sells new clothing. She has earned her livelihood in this manner for more than 11 years. Ruth started this business with very few products, but as time passed she was able to increase her inventory and her customer base.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, suits, and dresses. She dreams of improving her income and moving forward with this business.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, suits, and dresses.

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en:
Mwanaulu is applying for another loan to start a grocery business. She will use this 50,000 KES loan to purchase vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes and onions for resale. In the future, Mwanaulu hopes to continue improving and expanding her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanaulu has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Madame Mariama  est âgée  de 37 ans et vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 3 et 25ans. Elle s’active depuis plus de 4 ans dans le commerce et la vente de tissus teintés. C’est une activité qu’elle a hérité de sa maman et aussi qui lui procure beaucoup de passion. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle habite depuis juillet 2011 et sollicite un crédit de 150000frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus teintés destinés  à la vente. Son objectif est de renforcer son activité de commerce, augmenter ses profits et améliorer ses conditions de vie sociale.
texts.en: Mrs. Mariama is 37 years old and lives in Senegal. She is a married mother of 7 children, who are between the ages of 3 and 25. She has been selling dyed fabrics for over 4 years. It’s a business that she inherited from her mother and for which she also has a lot of passion. She has been a member of one of her local UIMCEC banks since July 2011 and is seeking a loan of 150,000 frs to buy dyed fabrics to resell. Her goal is to grow her business, increase her profits, and improve the conditions of her social life.

loans.use: to buy dyed fabrics to resell

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Roger tiene su negocio de venta de leche agria y  desde hace diez años en su casa de habitación, el vende de lunes a sábados desde las siete de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, además es fuente de trabajo ya que cuenta con catorce vendedores quienes se encargan de vender en los diferentes mercados de la capital de Managua.
El es casado con dos  hijos, pero solo uno depende de el, en esta ocasión el acude a ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de varios litros de leche para su negocio. Ha trabajado cinco prestamos con ceprodel y todos estos han sido para la compra de mercadería y equipo para la distribución de la leche.
texts.en:
Mr. Roger has his own butter milk business which he has been running out of his home for ten years.  He works Monday through Saturday from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  He has 14 salespeople who sell his products at different the markets in the capital city Managua.

He is married and has two children, although only one is his dependant.  He is requesting a loan through Ceprodel to buy several liters of milk for his business.  He already has had five loans through Ceprodel which he has used to buy merchandie and equipment for milk distribution.

loans.use: To buy several gallons of milk.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Upendo Mikolola Group

texts.en:
Costansia is a 41-year-old mother of four children, three of whom are attending primary school. She has performed well in the production of coffee, maize, and beans for over eight years. She has been facing farming problems, basically because of lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Costansia is working hard to find more funds to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. Also, she is working hard to expand her scale of production from 6 to 14 acres, so that in five years to come she may be able to build a better house, to cover medical expenses, and pay for school fees.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Lavi Miyo De Savann Okan Group

texts.fr:
Marie  est la coordinatrice de son groupe lavi miyo

Elle n'est pas marié et elle a 7 enfants.

Marie habite dans la région de savanne aux camps nord `est d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Marie a dirigé son commerce de produit divers pendant les dernières 6 années.

 Avant de commencer ce commerce Marie était une venduse de poisson.

Marie voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans des vente des produits divers. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce.

Des autres membres de Lavi miyo ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vente de produits alimentaires et cosmétiques.

Marie dit que son rêve  est obtenir une epicerie.
texts.en:
Marie is the coordinator of the group Lavi Miyo. She is not married and has seven children. Marie lives in the savannah region in the northeastern camps of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is scarce.

Marie has managed her business selling a variety of products for the last six years. Before beginning this business Marie was a fish seller.

Marie would like to use this loan to invest in the sale of diverse products. She hopes that this loan will help her to obtain a bigger business. Other members of Lavi Miyo need a loan for businesses such as the sale of food products and cosmetics. Marie says that her dream is to have a grocer's shop.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products (shoes, cosmetics, etc.).

loans.name: Zaragoza

texts.es: El  señor Zaragoza es  una  persona  trabajadora la cual lleva  varios  años  dedicándose a  la  carpintería esto le  a permitido  salir adelante  día  con  día ,  nos comenta  que   regularmente   sus  clientes  le  realizan pedidos de  diferentes   trabajos  y en  ocasiones   se le  complica elaborarlos ya  que no  cuenta  con la materia  prima  suficiente   para   realizarlos,  en esta  ocasión se  acerco a la institución  ya  que  requiere comprar madera  para  seguir   laborando,  ve   en  el crédito la posibilidad  de   hacer   crecer  su  negocio y   brindar  a su  familia  una  estabilidad  económica, por lo cual se  encuentra   muy contento de habernos  encontrado.
texts.en: Zaragoza is a hardworking person who has been a carpenter for some years and this has enabled him to keep going, day by day. He tells us that his clients regularly put in orders for different jobs and he sometimes has difficulty doing the work because he doesn't have enough raw materials for the job. He came to the micro-loan institution as he needs to buy wood in order to keep working. He sees the loan as an opportunity to keep growing the business and to offer his family some economic stability. For this reason, he is very happy to have found us.

loans.use: to buy wood for carpentry jobs.

loans.name: Shahla

texts.en:
With 10 years experience running her own beauty salon, Shahla is one of the great entrepreneur minded women in Iraq. Living in North-Iraq, Shahla is not only taking care of her business, but she is also a mother of 5 children and as such truly understands the meaning of multitasking and time management. 

Shahla is 48 years old and is currently managing her beauty salon located in the refurbished, street-front garage of her building. The spotless, colorful, yet in many ways modest salon meets clients' hair, beauty and make up needs with the help of her staff.

Shahla understands that building a clientele differs from keeping them and it is her priority to make sure her returning clients receive something new from time to time with constantly improving care. To facilitate her investments she took a loan in the past from Relief International Microfinance Iraq, which she used for purchasing a machine for facial treatments. Shahla successfully repaid the past loan. She decided to take a new loan, this time in the amount of USD 7000 to purchase high quality raw materials for her work. Also Shahala would like to move her salon away from her home to a new location. She has already made plans for the move which is expected to take place around August, and will use part of the loan for the miscellaneous costs of the move and make improvements to the salon.

Relief International Microfinance Iraq provides qualified clients with a loan product specifically tailored for Small and Medium Enterprises (or SMEs). Select SME entrepreneurs, featured on Kiva, are participants of the program "WLIFT: Leveraging the Internet for Financial Transformation", developed for women in Iraq in a partnership between Kiva, Relief International, and the Cherie Blair Foundation. In addition to receiving credit, these female entrepreneurs also benefit from targeted technical assistance and ongoing mentoring designed to stimulate growth in their businesses.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase high quality raw materials for her work and make improvements to the salon

loans.name: Carlos Alfonso

texts.es:
José, de 37 años de edad, es un hombre con deseos de trabajar y muy emprendedor, actualmente vive un tiempo con su papá y otros días con su mamá; José, tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad, que actualmente por situaciones económicas no puede tenerlo cerca de él, aunque lo ve todos los días.

José, obtuvo un crédito anteriormente, para colocar una pequeña tienda y le ha ido muy bien, ya que descubrió que es muy rentable; es por eso que quiere invertir más, su negocio mejoró considerablemente en los últimos meses y hoy cuenta con más ingresos, gracias al crédito que se le otorgó.

José, quiere seguir invirtiendo en más productos alimenticios para su tienda, es por esa razón que solicita otro crédito para comprar golosinas, galletas, gaseosas, entre otros productos. 

Su sueño es que su hijo estudie y sea una persona de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
37 year old José is an enterprising man with a desire to work. He currently lives with his father part of the time and on other days he lives with his mother. José has a 1 year old son who he can't currently keep with him for economic reasons, although he sees him every day. 
José had a loan previously to set-up a small store and it has done well and he has found it to be profitable. This is why he wants to invest more in his business. His business has grown considerably in the past few months and he now has greater income thanks to the loan that he was offered. 
José wants to invest in more food products for his store and this is why he is requesting a loan to buy candy, cookies, sodas, and other products.
He dream is the this son will study and become someone who is good for society.

loans.use: to buy candy, cookies, sodas, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase on his capital

loans.name: Vitoria

texts.en: "A good day's feed" is the motto behind Vitoria’s barbeque stand at Moamoa, which operates on a 4-day basis every week.  Financial assistance offered to her by SPBD helped set up the business. The initial $450 loan was used to buy meat (chicken, sausages, turkey tails) and taro for her stall.  Her husband also contributes financially to their family as he earns $100 fortnightly as a bus driver.  SPBD development programs and training assisted this family with knowledge, not only in financial assistance, but also with Victoria’s savings plan as she saves $10 each day from her business operation and $25 for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase barbeque stove, turkey tails, chicken, sausages, taro, and a pot; and cement, sand, timber, iron roof, and nails for the stand

loans.name: Lemalie

texts.en: Lemalie S. is thirty eight years old and has five children.  Lemalie inherited a small plantation from her parents and is working hard to ensure it remains in good condition.  The taro crop from her plantation provides for her family, so she is committed to investing in it to ensure that it remains a viable and steady source of income.  But the main obstacle to Lemalie securing a healthy crop is the limited water supply to her plantation.  She is applying for a loan to build fresh water lines to her farm.  She knows her parents would be proud of the improvements she is able to make to their legacy. She is certain that her children will appreciate the bright future she is working so hard to secure for them.

loans.use: to build water lines to supply taro plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his business

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana lives in Guadalupe in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. She's is part of a common-law union and has two small daughters, ages 2 and 8. Juana works for a local business but her salary is insufficient to cover all the needs of her children, so a year and a half ago she decided to start her own business selling food, initially hamburgers and roast sausage.

Now, thanks to the growing demand for her product, Juana wants to start selling steak as well and is requesting a loan of $475 to purchase a grill and necessary ingredients. She plans to repay the loan within six months. Juana is very grateful for the opportunity to improve the quality of life for her and her family and to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de Guadalupe en Nuevo León vive Juana, ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos pequeñas hijas, de 2 y 8 años de edad. Juana trabaja en una empresa de la localidad pero el salario que recibe es insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de sus pequeñas, por lo que decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de comidas desde hace año y medio, comenzó vendiendo hamburguesas y salchichas asadas.

Ahora gracias a la creciente demanda que tiene quiere incorporar la venta de carne asada y está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares para la compra de una parrilla e insumos que necesita para la elaboración de sus productos, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Juana agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase a grill and ingredients

loans.name: Jesús Armando

texts.es:
Jesus Armando is 47 years old, a hardworking family man who has sacrificed in order to learn about commercial activities. His diligence allowed him the opportunity to open a small eatery to which he dedicates a great deal of time and effort. His business has been so well-received, that he often is not able to accommodate customer demand due to the small number of tables and space. He would like to use his loan to make improvements to help him better meet customer demand and to further his economic prospects. He is motivated in great part by his two children, and his hopes of securing a better future for them. We appeal to your kindness in helping this honest and diligent father with his business endeavor.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Jesús Armando, de 47 años, es un vigoroso y noble padre de familia, que gracias a mucho sacrificio, pudo ganar experiencia en las actividades comerciales. Su continuo empeño le dió la posibilidad de aperturar una pequeña fuente de soda, en la que se dedica a diario laboriosamente.La gran acogida de este negocio a hecho que don Jesús, muchas veces no pueda atender a todos sus clientes, debido al pequeño espacio con el que cuenta, así mismo la poca cantidad de mesas que dispone no satisface las peticiones ni demandas de los jóvenes a quién gentilmente aguarda tarde a tarde, es por ello que desea implementar adecuadamente su local con todos los requerimientos que sean necesarios a fin de que el negocio pueda prosperar e incrementar las satisfacciones de muchas personas durante su permanencia.La gran motivación con la que cuenta son sus dos hijos por los cuales quiere seguir perseverando en esta labor y con el propósito de continuar solicita la suma de 175 dólares.Apelamos ahora a su buen corazón para poder contribuir con el crecimiento financiero de este noble y trabajador padre de familia.

loans.use: Make improvements to small eatery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in his poultry business

loans.name: Félix Máximo

texts.es:
Felix was born in the Ayacucho department. He decided to migrate to the capital because he had heard of a distant cousin that had a artisan weaving workshop in Lurin. Thanks to God, as was mentioned, he received it and gave him work. He began to concentrate all his energy in learning all the techniques of weaving and thanks to the fine finish of his products, the same people that were clients of his family motivated him to begin his own business because his work was of a very high quality and they wanted to do direct business with him. Married with two children, he made the decision to seek a place to live and have a workshop.

The money that he was able to save was enough to acquire land in the high area and he also bought some very rustic, small artisan weaving machines. He still works with them because his budget is not enough. Now there are seven members of his household: him, his wife, their four children and his brother who came to the town and asked him for work.

His artisan weavings are made with Alpaca, Ovino and Llama wool. They have a good finish and it is because of this that his market is basically the exclusive areas of the capital that recognize the quality of the product and pay a fair price. Felix, now 36 years old, has a dream, to be able to have a bigger workshop to give work to more people in his town that are known for this kind of work, as this will allow him to learn and prevent his family from feeling hunger and cold.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer.

Félix nació en el Departamento de Ayacucho. Decide migrar a la capital porque había escuchado de un primo lejano que tenia un taller de tejidos artesanales en Lurín, Gracias a Dios, como menciona, lo recibió y le dio trabajo. Empezó a concentrar toda su energía para aprender todas las técnicas de tejido y gracias al buen acabado de sus productos, los mismos clientes que eran del familiar lo motivaron a que iniciara su propio negocio porque sus trabajos eran de muy buena calidad y querían hacer el trato directo con él. Ya casado y con la presencia de 2 hijos toma la decisión de buscar un terreno donde vivir y poner un taller. El dinero que había logrado ahorrar le alcanzó para adquirir su terreno en la parte alta de un cerro y además compró unas pequeñas máquinas tejedoras artesanales muy rústicas; aún sigue trabajando con ellas porque su presupuesto no le alcanza, ahora son siete integrantes en casa, él, su esposa, sus cuatro hijos y su hermano que vino de su pueblo y le ha pedido trabajo. Sus tejidos artesanales son elaborados con lana de Alpaca, Ovino y Llama; tienen buen acabado, es por ello que su mercado es básicamente en zonas exclusivas de la capital que reconocen la calidad del producto y pagan el precio justo. Félix, hoy con sus 36 años tiene un anhelo, poder tener un taller amplio para dar trabajo a mas personas de su pueblo quienes son conocedores de este tipo de trabajo, además que esto le permita aprender y evite que su familia pasen hambre y frío.

loans.use: To increase his weaving workshop

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en: Mrs. Sreymom and her husband live in Koh Dach Iceland on the Mekong River. She married in 1993 and has six children, two girls and four boys. She learned weaving from her mother and started to weave in 1990. Thereafter she taught her husband to weave, too. Four of her children study at the school in the village, but the others are still very young. She buys material and sells finished products to the middle man, through which she can generate $3 in income per day. Sreymom is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the seventh time, this time in the amount of $300 to buy silk materials and sewing thread and pay other costs for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Oñondivepa (Means Group

texts.en:
The committee of women works hard to insure the well being of their families. They are al friends and neighbors; working women who wish to expand their businesses. With the loan, they will individually invest in their businesses, buying goods such as new and used clothing, shoes, various fruits and vegetable, household items, and baking ingredients.

This is a group of very humble women who are trying to keep gaining an income so they can support their children. All of them hope to keep their children in school, so that they may have a greater opportunity to increase their economic position in life.

loans.use: To buy pieces of clothing new and used, vegetables, fruits, rice, and various baking goods.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr:
Born around 1958 in the economic capital of BENIN, Mrs S. Jeannette is married and mother of 4 children. A seamstress by profession, she also sells fabric loinclothes as well as goods such as buttons, threads and linings. She also does a lot of baby clothes because of the demands of her clients. She is asking for a loan to respond to the increasing demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1958 dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame S. Jeannette est mariée et mère de 4enfants. Couturière de profession, elle mène parallèlement à celle-ci la vente des tissus pagnes, des produits de mercerie tels que les boutons, les fils, les doublures, etc. Elle s’investie beaucoup dans la layette à cause de la demande de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite ce crédit afin de répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 40 spools of thread, 15 pieces of fabric and 5 roles of lining

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is a woman who works hard to help support her family.  She works many hours trying to earn a meager income from her food stall in the market of Dogolia village.  She sells basic food items and produce.  She is ready to expand her business and access a loan.  She needs Le 800,000 to begin the much needed expansion of her business so that she can meet her customers' needs and demands.  Having a well stocked market will allow her to establish a reputation as a reliable retailer in her community.

loans.use: to expand her collection of food items and stock

loans.name: Komlakuma Dzigi

texts.fr:
"Institut de Providence" is a primary school established by Professor Komlakuma Dzigi N.. Professor N. is 48 years old, married, and the father of three. Since 2003, "Institut de Providence" has served the people of Kpalimé, one of the biggest cities in Togo. In 2007, the enrollment was 500 students. Professor N. wishes to use his loan to buy supplies for the Institute such as notebooks, pencils, and chalk. Also, he hopes to continue his program of sponsoring poor students, who cannot pay for school fees. Professor N. has made a big difference in his community. And with this loan, he wishes to continue providing a good education to the children of Kpalimé.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

« Institut de Providence » est une école primaire établie par Professeur Komlakuma Dzigi N.. Professeur N. est âgé de 48 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Depuis 2003, « Institut de Providence » a servi la population de Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. En 2007, l’enrôlement était 500 étudiants. Professeur N. souhaite d’utiliser son crédit pour acheter des matériaux pour l’Institut, comme les cahiers, les crayons et la craie. Aussi, il espère continuer son programme à patronner les élèves pauvres qui ne peuvent pas payer les frais scolaires. Professeur N. a créée une grande différence dans son communauté et avec ce crédit il souhaite à continuer fournir avec une bonne éducation aux enfants de Kpalimé.

loans.use: To buy supplies for the school and to pay school fees

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Z. Rano is 36 years old. She is married and has two children. Her elder daughter is studying at the university, and her son is at school. Her husband is a market vendor, and Rano is a seamstress, sewing national dresses for women and girls. She has been involved in this business for more than sixteen years and, over time, has gained rich experience. The fabrics required for sewing Rano buys herself in a local market. During her long career as a businesswoman, Rano has become a very popular seamstress and receives many orders. That is why her business has been stable and served as the main source of income for her family. 
Today Rano is requesting a loan of US$600 for a term of 12 months to be able to purchase modern fabrics for sewing. Rano thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate in loan payment.

loans.use: Purchase of modern fabrics for a tailoring business

loans.name: Tarcila Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is a 36-year-old mother of three children. Rebeca and her husband have a restaurant called Perú-China, located on a central street in Ayacucho. The restaurant specializes in chicken and Chinese food. Her husband is in charge of preparing the food with the help of three employees. Furthermore, Rebeca sells catalog cosmetics that she offers to friends and relatives.

Rebeca is a member of Las Entusiastas Village Bank. She needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to invest in cooking oil and cosmetics.

Rebeca’s dream is to expand her business, to have another business, own a home, and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in cooking oil and cosmetics

loans.name: Yann

texts.en:
Mrs. Yann S., a farmer in Vihea Village in Kandal Province, cultivates rice and vegetables in her field twice a year. Her husband, Mr. Kuon Kith, is a pig breeder. The problem Mrs. S. currently faces is an insufficient amount of money to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for her farming. Thus, she is requesting a loan for this purpose, with the remainder of the loan being used to purchase pesticides. 

Mrs. Yann S. is 42 years old and the mother of eight children, one of whom is a labourer who uses oxen to plow for a profit while five are attending school. The remaining two are too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Yann S. obtained a loan, now fully repaid, from Acleda Bank to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to cultivate.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her farming

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Aunty D., as she is popularly called by her numerous customers, is a 51-year-old local restaurant operator. She is a widow but blessed with six children. With income from her business, she has provided for three of her children to graduate from high school.

In her restaurant, Aunty D. prepares and sells local dishes such as "fufu" and "banku" and "abetie". Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup.

Auntie D. says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials, such as bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. Hannah is a member of a group called Isaiah Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Emelia J.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 55-year-old Emelia J. M. from Tukuyu. She is married with six children between the ages of 18 and 35 and is also responsible for supporting two dependents because they are street children. Emelia, assisted by her husband, has been running a fish-selling business since 2006, working 10 hours per day, 7 days per week.

Currently earning about $35 a month from her business, she is requesting a loan of $250 to increase her bulk purchases of fish in order to realize more profit. In the future, Emelia plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To increase her bulk purchases of fish.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad was born in 1968. He is married and has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, and settled in the Khirdalan settlement. This man has sold building materials for 6 years. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts

loans.name: Ziyadkhan

texts.en:
Ziyadkhan J. is a hard-working entrepreneur from a southern city of Azerbaijan called Sabirabad. He is married and the happy father of three children. He owns a market vending business where he sells men’s shirts, hats and shoes. Ziyadkhan decided to start his own business when he retired on pension. It was very hard to keep his family on a pension that was very low. Now, Ziyadkhan has a successful business and works in his own store all day. Income coming from this store is the only financial source in his family.

Ziyadkhan has requested a loan of $1200 USD. He will purchase suits with the purpose of increasing his profit. Ziyadkhan will use the profits from his business to improve his standard of living and do some remodelling of his home.

loans.use: To purchase suits for sale

loans.name: Thou

texts.en: Mrs. Thou P. was born in 1966 and now lives in the Tbeng Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a small piece of land for a living. Her husband, Mr. Seom Ol, uses a motorbike to pull a cart in order to transport firewood to re-sell. Although Mrs. Thou P. and her husband try to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to support the family, and they also live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Thou P. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family. Mrs. Thou P. has six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one helps the father with the business. The remaining three are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her family

loans.name: Nabeela Royan Masih Group

texts.en:
Nabeela baji is a 35-year-old married woman who has lived in Ismail Nagar in Lahore, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Her parents were not able to provide a good education for her, so she left her school after completing 5th standard. She is married to R. M.. He has been selling children's clothing for the past 4 years. 

Nabeela baji is the mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. Her eldest son does lath work. The others attend a school near their house. Nabeela baji belongs to a family of farmers. She has a buffalo in her house and takes care of it. She gets milk from her and sells the milk in milk shops and earns a profit. She does this work to fulfill the needs of her children. 

Nabeela baji successfully repaid her two previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more garments to expand her husband’s business. 

She is the group leader of a group of women of her locality. Munawar baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth  business. Ghafooran baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Mussarat baji wants a loan to buy tools for her business repairing electric items. Razia baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr.Francisco Durè tiene 38 años de edad,está casado con la Sra.Mabel Espínola,viven en casa  propia en la ciudad de Carapeguà juntos tienen dos hijos en edad escolar.

             Se  conocieron desde  muy  jovenes  y se unieron  en pareja  intentaron  varias actividades para  poder salir adelante,  entre ellos vendieron  ropas y mas adelante  reunieron  un  pequeño capital y  pudieron dar  apertura a un  pequeño negocio en su domicilio ,.una pequeña despensa que  gracias a su  buena  ubicaciòn  y  buena  variedad de productos  consiguiò  muy buena clientela   

            Con el credito  obtenido comprarà  azucar ,arroz ,yerba
texts.en:
Francisco Durè is 38 years old, married with Mabel Espínola with whom he lives in a house he owns in the city of Carapeguà with their two school-aged children. They have known each other since they were very young and as a team have tried various businesses to better their situation. They have sold clothing and saved a small amount of money with which they opened a small business in their home: a small store which has drawn a good customer base because of its good location and variety of products for sale. He will use the loan to buy sugar, rice and herbs.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and herbs

loans.name: Lilian K.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Lilian C. from Mbeya. She is married and has two children aged 5 and 11. Lilian has been running a stationery business since 2007. She buys stationery materials wholesale and sells them retail.

Lilian works at her business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Lilian currently earns about $300 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $625 USD to purchase more stationary materials for her business. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. Lilian thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borro

loans.use: Tto purchase more stationary materials for her business

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio B., 33 years old, is a good father and husband, and is happily married to Angelica. They have two children: Isaac - 6 years old, grade one; and Iamron - 4 years old. They live in the simple village of Minanga Proper, a rural area where farming is the common source of income for the residents. 

Rogelio is a village store owner. Aside from his store, he has also been engaged in the business of raising hogs for almost a year, for extra income. His weekly income from his store is not enough to support the needs of his family and the education of his son. With this in mind, he is requesting a loan amount of PHP11,000 as additional capital.  This amount will be of great help in improving his business. He dreams that someday he can sustain all the needs of his family.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki has been a khanga seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to Hidaya njema group loan (Group code 2021). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day, she works at her business for 7 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more khanga and other items for sale, to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Riziki is 28 years old, married, and has two children: ages 6 and 3.

loans.use: To buy more khanga and other items for sale, to improve her business.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Tim N., 45, is a widowed farmer who lives with three of her children. Living in the Takeo province, she typically makes US $1.60 every day and is aided by her daughter who sells beverages. As a farmer, Tim N. is taking the brunt of the economic downturn. That is why she has approached CREDIT with a request for a loan. Tim N. is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase fertilizer and raise pigs, a purchase that she sees as a good opportunity to increase her income.

loans.use: For fertilizer and pigs

loans.name: Zachariah

texts.en:
Zachariah is forty-five years old. He is married and a father with four children. His wife is a farmer and all his children are in school in the community where they live. He has been a general photographer for the past ten years. He also sells ointment for skin rashes.

He owns a photography and video shop where his clients pose for their photographs. He also travels to occasions like parties and concerts to take photographs of his clients. He requests the loan to enable him buy additional tools and materials like a camera, flash, video camera and other things to expand his operations. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: For additional photography equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase trees.

loans.name: María Genara

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, la señora María J. se dedica a su negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos los cuales son  comercializados por ella misma en su localidad.

Es de mucha importancia destacar que ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace 20 largos años y por esto es que ha adquirido mucha experiencia en la elaboración de los alimentos por lo que es muy visitada por las personas que a diario compran los deliciosos alimentos que ella prepara.
texts.en:
María J. works with much enthusiasm and the desire to get ahead. She makes and sells food. She sells the food herself at her site. She has been in this business for 20 long years, and she has gained a lot of experience making food. Therefore, she has a lot of people come to her site daily to buy the delicious food that she prepares.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stocking her little store

loans.name: Lucia Iveth

texts.es: La señorita Lucia M. tiene 27 años de edad, habitante de la comarca los Cedro, de la comunidad de Villa del Carmen del departamento de Managua, trabaja en el cargo de Responsable de Caja desde hace seis meses anteriormente trabaja en el mismo cargo con el otro gobierno. Agradece a la Institución por brindarle el acensó a un préstamo del cual comprara materiales de construcción  como: cemento, hierro, bloque, piedra y otros materiales. Construir un anexo de su vivienda, da las gracias a la institución por el préstamo ya que lograra tener una casa digna.
texts.en:
Lucia M. is 27 years old. She lives in the Los Cedros region in the Villa del Carmen community, located in the state of Managua. She has worked as a cashier for the past 6 months, a position she also held under the prior government administration. She thanks the Bank for providing her with access to a loan that she will use to purchase construction materials such as cement, rebar, concrete blocks, stone and other materials. She will be building an addition to her home and thanks the Institution for the loan that will provide her with a decent house.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build her home

loans.name: Ear

texts.en:
Ear Y., age 42, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband and children in Takeo province.

Y. is engaged in a business selling groceries and soft drinks from her home, earning approximately US$13 per day. Her husband is a motorcycle repairman at home, too, earning a gross income of US$13 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, Y. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most.

In light of the country's economic difficulties, Y. is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a machine for her husband’s business of repairing motorcycles. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to generate more income and save more money to raise a good standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a machine for her husband's motorcycle repair business

loans.name: Oyeyiola

texts.en: Oyeyiola is 55 years old and married with five children.  He sells cement and blocks and hopes for a loan of of N180,000 to purchase more cement and blocks to sell.  He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cement and blocks to sell

loans.name: La Prueba Group

texts.es:
El grupo la prueba está conformado por tres mujeres excepcionales que desean salir a delante y trabajar arduamente por ellas y sus familias, estas son: 

Reyna Espinosa de 39 años de edad quien trabaja vendiendo frutas y verduras en el mercado oriental desde los 7 años. El sueño de ella es poder tener su propio tramo y que sus hijos logren prepararse. 

Sonia Esperanza R. tiene un pequeño puesto de verduras en su pueblo Reparto Roberto Lara  que es de la zona rural de Nindiri y Simona del Carmen L. que vende raspado, un postre típico nicaragüense de hielo y miel en las calles de Masaya.

Ellas invertirán su crédito en la compra de materia prima para su puesto como yuca, ayote, pián, pepino, tomate , naranja, pitaya y piña entre otros.
texts.en:
The Group La Prueba is composed of three exceptional women that wish to get ahead in life and work arduously for themselves and their families. They are as follows:

Reyna Espinosa is 39 years old and has worked selling fruits and vegetables in the Mercado Oriental for the past 7 years. She dreams of setting up her own stall and that her children receive an education.

Sonia Esperanza R. has a small vegetable stand in her town of Reparto Roberto Lara, which is located in the rural zone Nindiri. Simona del Carmen L. sells ‘raspado’, a traditional Nicaraguan desert that consists of shaved ice and honey sold on the streets of Masaya.

They will invest their loan in the purchase of basic materials for their stand, such as yucca, chayote, zucchini, cucumber, tomatoes, oranges, dragon fruit, and pineapple, amongst others.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic materials for their stand, such as yucca, chayote, zucchini, cucumber, tomatoes, oranges, dragon fruit, and pineapple, amongst others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a supply of sodabi.

loans.name: Xenia Marisol

texts.es: Xenia Marisol  G. originaria del departamento de Chalatenango. Vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas  Lorena de 12 años de edad y Saúl de 8 de edad, ambos niños estudian. El esposo de Xenia trabaja como motorista, él ha ayudado a su esposa a montar este pequeño negocio, con el cual Xenia ayuda a su esposo en los pagos del hogar, a pesar de hacer invertido sus ahorros para instalar su tienda, no fueron suficientes para poderla surtir plenamente, es por ello que Xenia solicita de un crédito que le ayude a invertir en variedad y cantidad de mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Xenia Marisol G. is originally from the department of Chalatenango. She lives with her husband and two school-aged children, Lorena (age 12) and Saúl (age 8). Her husband works as a taxi driver and helped her establish a small business. This enables Xenia to help him with the household expenses. Even though they were able to open their store through the use of their savings, the couple does not have sufficient income to keep their business fully stocked. For this reason, Xenia is requesting a loan to help her acquire a variety of merchandise in large quantities for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire inventory for her business

loans.name: Yola Nohemi

texts.es:
La señora Yola es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor Andina” ubicado en el  distrito de Platería, Provincia Puno,  Departamento de Puno; tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo, vive en la av. Platería, estudió educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, con el cual comprará ganado vacuno (vacas)  para engorde, para venderlo en la feria de Acora cada semana. La señora tambien se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías por pedidos..

Su mayor deseo es formar una empresa de venta de artesanías.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las charlas.
texts.en:
Yola is a member of the "Flor Andina" ("Flower of the Andes") communal bank, located in the Platería district of Puno province, Department of Puno. She is 27 years old and lives with her partner on Platería Avenue; she has one child and has completed her primary education. Yola has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past two years. Her first loan, for 300 Peruvian soles, provided increased capital for her retail business of buying and selling livestock. She currently needs a new loan of 1500 soles, which she will use to purchase cattle to fatten up and sell at the Acora market each week. Yola also works making handicrafts in response to orders. Her greatest desire is to start a business selling handicrafts. She enjoys saving money and attending informational lectures.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cattle

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур Сафаралиев проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 29 лет. Женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Баходур имеет высшее образованние. Он имеет хлебопекарню, где печет национальные лепешки, которые потом продает на рынке. Кредит просит для закупа сырья, т.е. муки.
texts.en:
Bahodur S. lives in Kulob City. He's twenty-nine years old, married and has one child. Bahodur has a college education. He owns a bakery, where he bakes ethnic flat breads, which he then sells on the market. He is requesting a loan in order to buy additional ingredients, such as flour.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase production

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie F. is from the village of Paddad, Alicia, Isabela. She is 40 years old and married with two school-age children. To make a living, Josie owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Josie has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 200 PHP daily.

Josie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josie is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Josie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ann Joy

texts.en: Ann Joy is a 26-year-old married woman from Agusan del Sur. She has a 6-year-old child whom she loves taking care of. She has dreams for her family, which she is eager to achieve. She is involved in rice farming and currently owns a hectare of rice field. She says her rice crops need some supplies in order to grow healthy. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI, which she will use to purchase the necessary supplies for her farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goods.

loans.name: Mame Bousso

texts.fr: Mame Bousso T. est une femme de 27 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants et a la garde de 2 autres enfants qu'on lui a confiés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis 5 ans et a eu 10 expériences avec le crédit. Son prêt lui permet de développer une activité de restauration. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mame Bousso T. is a 27-year-old married mother of four children, and has two other children who have been placed in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Walidane for 5 years, and has had 10 previous loan experiences. Her loan will allow her to develop a food preparation business. She contributes to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her commercial activity

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola es una joven de 20 años, vive con Julio, de 22 años, con quien tiene un hijo de 8 meses de nacido. Esta familia vive en su casa propia ubicada en la selva central peruana.

Ella es consiente de que ser madre es un reto muy difícil, más no imposible. Por eso, junto a su esposo, desde hace 5 años se dedican a la venta de frutas regionales. De esta labor lo que más le gusta es ir a las chacras para comprar los frutos, pues se distrae mucho al caminar, por otro lado le molesta tener que insistir en la cobranza a los deudores quienes sacan fruta de su establecimiento al crédito. “Mi negocio es rentable porque puedo comprar mis electrodomésticos para vivir cómodamente, puedo solventar los gastos domiciliarios sin problema y hasta ahorrar para alguna eventualidad “, comenta Paola. A la vez que refiere que para el futuro piensa comprar un camión para trasladar su mercadería a diferentes lugares del país, así ser convertiría en una distribuidora mayorista de fruta.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y le parece interesante la modalidad de trabajo de su banco comunal, donde piensa participar activamente para aprender más del trabajo en equipo. Los 700 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de variedad de frutas oriundas de la zona, las cuales encajonará para que estén listos para la venta.
texts.en:
Paola is a 20 year-old young woman that lives with Julio, whom is 22 years old, and with whom she has an 8 month-old baby. They live in their own house which is located in the central Peruvian forest. She realizes that being a mother is a big challenge but not an impossible one. As such, she, alongside her husband, have dedicated themselves for the past 5 years to the sale of regional fruit.
